cleopatra bathed in donkey-milk baths and used rose petals as a face mask . egyptian queen nefertiti made her own cosmetics using lead-based kohl . ancient india used cow dung and urine to boost their beauty regime .
a pregnant jehovah's witness woman and her baby have died after she refused a blood transfusion . the 28-year-old was diagnosed with leukemia seven months into her pregnancy . doctors told her she could give birth via caesarean section and undergo chemotherapy but both would require a blood transfusion . the sydney woman refused both options due to her religious beliefs . she had a stillbirth and died 13 days after her diagnosis after suffering a stroke and multi-organ failure .

scientists at the rockefeller university in new york believe a new hiv antibody therapy could pave the way for an hiv vaccine . clinical trials revealed the treatment resulted in a 300-fold decrease in the amount of hiv in sufferers' blood . the antibody was designed by researchers to block the key viral protein receptor that is needed to infect human blood cells .

astronomers have used a telescope in new mexico to watch a star take shape over eight years . the first image was taken with the karl g. jansky very large array in new mexico in 1996 . the second image was taken by an international team led by the national autonomous university of mexico last year . it shows how the outflow of material from the star has dramatically expanded as it takes shape .

planes coming from south-east asian countries are being routinely fumigated before luggage is removed . the exotic mosquito aedes aegypti is responsible for an annual outbreak of dengue in north queensland . the blood suckers were discovered in the international baggage terminal on february 17, march 30 and again on march 31 . in february authorities were forced to step up bio security at perth, adelaide and brisbane airports after exotic mosquitoes were found in cargo holds .

dna-like fragments may have come with 'instructions' that guided their growth into complex life forms 4 billion years ago . the study, by the university of milan and university of colorado boulder, is based on a discovery in the 1980s that rna can chemically alter its own structure . rna is similar to dna, and carries out a number of jobs in our cells, including acting as an on-and-off switch for some genes .

the dragon king dinosaur skull is being sold by hong kong-based experts evolve . it is more than 95 per cent complete bone, is 9.2ft (2.8 metres) long, 5.2ft (1.6 metres) high and 4.6ft (1.4 metres) wide . it belonged to a male triceratops that lived 66 million years ago . the auction is open now and the fossil is expected to fetch $1.8 million (£1.2 million)

dr zoe waller, 31, suffers from the skin condition dermatographia . it is a type of urticaria, or hives, where a raised, itchy rash appears on the skin . it is thought to be caused when the cells under the surface of the skin release histamines under the slightest pressure . she uses a blunt pencil or cocktail stick to draw on her skin .

as short waves collide near the surface they create weak microseismic waves, which combine with long waves on the ocean's floor to create a constant hum . earthquakes shake the planet in such a way that the earth can oscillate for months after the seismic event .

if all ice were to be spread across the surface of mars, the entire planet would be covered in more than 3.3ft (one metre) of ice . the findings were made by scientists at the niels bohr institute at the university of copenhagen . they measured how big the glaciers are, and their similarity to glaciers on earth .

the sokaze-ki q uses fluid dynamics to take air in small inlets on the rear . it is then moved using so-called impellers through specially designed channels . this airflow pulls in additional air from air inlets plotted around the q . all of this air is released through the main outlet on the 10-inch device . panasonic japan, which designed the device, said that once the turbofan has moved the air flow to the front, a 'high-pressure jet airflow' creates straight, direct blasts of air .

researchers from the university of patras took thermal infrared photographs of 41 volunteers’ faces, before and after drinking four glasses of wine . they then used artificial neural networks to compare the sober and drunken images pixel-by-pixel . the algorithm determines a person’s state of intoxication by looking at the temperature of their forehead and nose .

johns hopkins university researchers reviewed 4,200 studies involving diets . only a few dozen met the scientific gold standard of reliability . only a few have shown users lose more weight than those not using them . others produce no better results than dieting on their own or getting health information elsewhere, while some may actually be harmful to health . but a handful - including weight watchers, the atkins diet, jenny craig and nutrisystem - do appear to be effective, according to long-term studies .

meaningless symbols have been daubed on walls or pavements in lanarkshire . but the squiggles are actually thought to be a 'code' for potential housebreakers . they give potential housebreakers details about the building, such as whether it is a good target or has an alarm . other marks could suggest that the occupant is vulnerable or that there is nothing inside the property worth taking .

until now it was thought that dark matter did not interact with anything other than gravity . durham university scientists studied a 'clump' of dark matter that appears to be lagging behind its galaxy - suggesting it interacts with itself . this is despite seeming to account for 85 per cent of the universe’s mass and having an effect on galaxies . but when it comes to the total energy in the universe, it is split in the proportions 68 per cent dark energy, 27 per cent dark matter and 5 per cent 'normal' matter .

university of cologne scientist led research proposing a new theory . it suggests temperatures at earth's equator were -40°c (-40°f) 2.4 billion years ago . the reasons why the whole planet was frozen are not understood . but it could have implications for finding life on frozen moons like europa . a frozen planet circling just one of a pair of stars could improve the chances of finding alien life .

research led by the university of montana has found that eating fast food after a workout may be just as beneficial as dietary supplements . researchers found that during recovery periods between periods of exercise, it didn’t matter what food was eaten . performance remained the same after resting for several hours . levels of glycogen - used by muscles as ‘fuel’ - were actually slightly higher after fast food was eaten as a recovery food .

excess salt contributes to the deaths of tens of thousands of americans each year . guidelines currently dictate the people should limit their intake to 2,300 milligrams, with an even stricter 1,500 milligram limit for african americans and people over 50 . skeptics however believe most americans are fine - a typical healthy person can consume as much as 6,000 milligrams per day without significantly raising health risks .

researchers at the university of bath and yale university created the invention . it uses a newly designed molecular catalyst to split water in an electrolyser . the catalyst is more efficient at performing the crucial oxidation half of the reaction than any other existing material, minimising energy losses . hydrogen could now be used more easily as a way to store energy from renewable sources like wind and solar .

ephedra foeminea waits for the full moon to 'bloom' in the moonlight . at night, the non-flowering relative of conifers secretes tiny droplets of sugary fluid to attract pollinating insects . they ooze from the plant’s female organs where seeds are produced . when a nocturnal butterfly or insect lands on one of the tasty transparent orbs at night, the pollen it’s carrying is used to fertilise the seed .

reddit launched its r/thebutton thread on april fool's day . more than 730,285 users have pressed the button since then . it is not yet known what happens when the timer reaches zero . users get a purple flair when they press the button between 52 and 60 seconds . blue flairs are awarded between 42 and 51 seconds, green flairs are between 32 and 41 seconds, yellow flairs are between 22 and 31 seconds, orange flairs are between 12 and 21 seconds .

the first complex conversation between humans took place around 50,000 to 100,000 years ago . much of it involved cavemen grunting, or hunter-gatherers mumbling and pointing, before learning to speak in a detailed way . but in a new study, one linguist argues that human language developed rapidly with people quickly using complex sentences that sound like our own . he says single words bear traces of syntax showing that they must be descended from an older, syntax-laden system, rather than from simple, primal utterances .

norwich scientists have developed an adaptor for colour blindness . eye2tv can be plugged into any hdmi port on a tv or a computer monitor . a remote control or app then adjusts the colour adjustment . it allows colour blind people to watch shows they otherwise couldn't . and the effect is such that someone with normal vision will barely notice any change in the picture . and the team is seeking £100,000 ($150,000) of funding on kickstarter .

the map uses data from the california roadkill observation system, a volunteer-submitted database of instances where wildlife and vehicles collided over the past five years . it assigns different coloured markers for various sizes of species . clicking on the dots reveals the species - striped skunk, mountain lion, black bear, gopher snake, desert iguana - and where and when they were hit .

a spring storm that had doused northern california for the previous 24 hours arrived in southern california on tuesday night . the storm brought mostly light but necessary rainfall across a region that has been experiencing extreme drought conditions . thousands were without power for several hours because of the storm, and the dodgers had a rare rain delay on the second day of the season . earlier in the day, the unusually cold spring storm brought heavy rain and hail to parts of northern california and coated the mountains in snow .

hospitalizations from car crashes dropped 7 percent between 2003 and 20010 in the 45 states with texting bans . arizona, texas, montana, missouri, and oklahoma are the only five states in america that do not have texting bans for all drivers . the greatest benefit was seen in states where texting bans are strictly enforced and where an officer can stop a car just on suspicion the driver breaking the law .

psychologists at new york university have been trying to understand how the brain stores memories for 'emotionally neutral events' this is because emotion affects activity in brain regions involved in emotional processing - particularly the amygdala and striatum . strong emotion can strengthen memory for positive events, such as a birthday party thrown by close friends, and for negative events, such as making an embarrassing faux pas at the office holiday party .

swiss researchers measured the temperature of 'hot jupiter' hd 189733b . they found the temperature reaches up to 3,000°c in the atmosphere . and wind speeds are in excess of 620 miles per hour . findings were made using a novel technique relying on sodium signals . it reveals the planet has an extremely turbulent atmosphere and is almost certainly inhospitable to life .

photographer jeffrey milstein has shot a fascinating project documenting black boxes, shedding light on what happens to the devices after tragic crashes . despite the name, the boxes are usually red to help rescuers spot them among the wreckage of crashed planes and helicopters . mr milstein's work saw him gain access to air safety storage facilities where data recorders end up following an accident . the boxes, which record flight data and conversations between pilots, are incredibly important for discovering what led to a plane's crash .

surrender of confederate gen. robert e. lee to union lt. gen. ulysses s. grant 150 years ago on thursday was a milestone event in the end of the american civil war . thursday's commemoration in appomattox, virginia, included a reenactment of lee's last clash with grant's troops and of the confederate surrender in a virginia farmhouse on april 9, 1865 .

'we want to put the minds of holidaymakers at ease by showing that jellyfish are not as harmful as they may appear,' says stay in cornwall's matt fletcher . not all jellyfish found off uk beaches can sting humans, and for the majority of cases, stings are mild or easily treated .

the last of the woolly mammoths were isolated on an arctic island for around 5,000 years, forcing them to inbreed as their population dwindled . researchers have concluded that the creatures clung on in just a tiny pocket of the arctic, on an island that appears to have become cut off from the mainland . study has also raised the prospect of bringing the giant mammal back to life using cloning techniques with modern elephants .

the study was conducted by scientists at purdue university in indiana . they were investigating how to reduce bird to aircraft collisions by keeping birds away from planes . research showed that birds responded most to blue lights on planes . when the plane was stationary, the birds became alert more quickly when the lights were on, but when it approached them with its lights off, their response slowed . and they were also more likely to get out of the way of taxiing aircraft . and they were also more likely to get out of the way of taxiing .

dutch and canadian scientists asked 100 men and women to fill in a questionnaire every time they spent at least five minutes talking to someone else . about a fifth of the 1,000 meetings recorded took place over a meal . participants felt friendlier, listened more, gave more compliments and were more likely to make compromises .

neanderthals may have been unable to get as much energy from their food as modern humans who used fire . team of archaeologists at boston university and the university of bath believe this would have meant they lost out when modern humans arrived from africa . they used computer model the amount of energy neanderthals would have been able to get from their food without cooking it compared to humans that were . without fire, a group of neanderthals would have had less energy - the equivalent 12 reindeer a year .

two up is one of australia's longest lasting traditions . it dates back to australia's goldfields and the first recorded games are believed to have taken place in the late 1790s . the traditional game involves two coins but many venues now play with three for ease of betting among the crowd . the martingale betting strategy originated in france .

image shows a stellar nursery of about 3,000 stars called westerlund 2 located about 20,000 light-years from earth . hubble was launched on 24 april 1990 aboard space shuttle discovery . it is 43ft (12.3 metres) long and 14ft (4.2 metres wide) and orbits earth at a height of about 345 miles (555km) at a speed of 16,000 mph (27,750km/h)
common creams used to treat athlete's foot and eczema could undo the damage of multiple sclerosis, scientists claim . anti-fungal agent miconazole and steroid clobetasol both restored movement to mice paralysed by a rodent version of the disease . in laboratory tests, they prompted inactive mouse and human stem cells to regenerate myelin, the protective coating around nerve fibres that is destroyed by the disease .
pete evans has shared an incredible story about a woman who claims she no longer suffers multiple sclerosis . hollie, 30, was diagnosed with relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis in september 2013 . she endured months of constant dizziness, altered temperature perception, extreme fatigue, numbness in her legs and feet . marg, another ms sufferer, claims she has seen significant health improvements after being on evans' 10 weeks paleo program .
trade was taking place between east asia and the new world in 1492 . this is according to bronze artefacts found at the 'rising whale' site in alaska . archaeologists discovered what they believe to be a bronze and leather buckle and a bronze whistle, dating to around a.d. 600 . bronze-working had not been developed at this time in alaska, and researchers instead believe the artefacts were created in china, korea or yakutia .

neuroscientists at john hopkins medical school in baltimore identified the area of the brain that is the key to picking up on when someone is being sarcastic . they found people with damage to the right sagittal stratum - a bundle of white matter that lies between the cerebral cortex and subcortical structures in the brain - are unable to detect sarcasm . stroke survivors often suffer damage to this area of their brain and struggle to recognise when family and friends are being sarcastic .
the screw-like shape may actually be the reversed-shape of the creature, which gradually dissolved while the rock formed around it . russian researchers stumbled across the ‘screw’ after searching the kaluga region after an asteroid strike occurred there . they claim the stone is between 300 and 320 million years old and after x-raying it, believe there is another ‘screw’ inside the stone . but more conventional scientists have not got a look at the object, so have had to base their speculation on grainy pictures posted online .

severe weather warnings were issued by the bureau of meteorology on sunday . climate specialist don white from weatherwatch australia confirmed that severe weather warnings were issued . the storm formed in the worst possible spot, which was just north of newcastle . it then covered 150km south from newcastle to wollongong where a third of australia’s population live . powerful winds on monday night and tuesday morning also brought down scaffolding in edgecliff, in sydney's eastern suburbs .
cancer-killing cocktail of tamoxifen and two coffees found to reduce the risk of tumours returning by 50 per cent in women recovering from the disease . tamoxifen kills off cancer cells or stunts their growth by blocking the cancer-causing hormone oestrogen from reaching diseased cells . study of 1,090 breast cancer patients by british and swedish researchers at lund university, sweden .

the yellowstone supervolcano releases around 45,000 metric tonnes of carbon dioxide each day . a magma chamber beneath the surface is not considered large enough to produce these levels . researchers tracked seismic waves from almost 5,000 earthquakes . they found a secondary chamber deeper underground that's so large its partly-molten rock could fill the grand canyon 11 times over . the chamber contains around 98 per cent hot rock, while the remaining 2 per cent is molten rock and is too deep to directly cause an eruption .

hormone replacement therapy is used to ease the effects of menopause . after going through the menopause a woman's ovaries stop producing the hormone oestrogen . it triggers menopausal symptoms including hot flashes and mood swings . hrt is used to treat the body by introducing female sex hormones . scientists in the us and the uk have both found strong evidence that hrt increases a woman's risk of breast, womb and ovarian cancers .

life paint is a temporary light reflective spray for cyclists . volvo teamed up with a swedish start-up to make the spray for cyclists . it contains reflective particles designed to react to a car’s headlights . the spray is invisible by daylight but reflects light in the dark . it can be washed off and lasts for days on clothes, helmets and bikes . a trial began in london bike shops on 2 april and 2,000 cans were given away free .

developers in boston have worked with global emergency response teams to create its one-touch-911 app . users can call the police, fire service, report a car crash or seek medical help at the press of a button . each of the four buttons on the app trigger a standard call to nearby dispatchers . each call is placed with the phone's gps location, user details and any pre-entered medical information attached . if the user doesn't have signal on their network, the app lets them 'roam' onto another network to connect the call .
researchers say 75% of extreme hot weather and 18% of heavy precipitation is being driven by global warming as a result of man-made emissions . they warn as climate change pushes global temperatures higher, humans will be responsible for 40% of extreme rainfall events . temperatures across the world averaged 0.8°c (1.4°f) above 20th century averages - making 2014 the warmest year in records dating back 134 years .
the horseshoe-shaped glass walkway in chongqing extends 87.5ft from the edge of a cliff, allowing visitors to feel like they are walking on air . it is the longest cantilever bridge in the world, beating arizona’s grand canyon skywalk by 16.4ft . located in the longgang national geological park in south-west china, the bridge has been named yuanduan, meaning ‘at the end of the clouds’ .

the pillars of creation are one of the most iconic images ever to be captured by the hubble space telescope . new observations, taken by the european space agency, reveal many new details — including a jet from a young star . they shed about 70 times the mass of the sun every million years or so . based on their present mass of about 200 times that of the sun, the pillars of creation have an expected lifetime of perhaps three million more years .

new york governor andrew cuomo said friday that the synthetic marijuana product known as 'spice' is sweeping the city . 160 people have been hospitalized in the nine days from april 8, 120 of them in one week . the cannabinoid, also commonly called 'k2' or 'mojo', is predominantly abused by teenagers and typically sold over-the-counter as incense or potpourri .
california's century-old water rights system has been based on self-reporting and little oversight . delta farmers don't deny using as much water as they need, but say they're not stealing it because their history of living at the water's edge gives them that right . gov. jerry brown has said that if drought continues this system built into california's legal framework will probably need to be examined .

mindfulness-based cognitive therapy (mbct) has similar recurrence rates as anti-depressants, a study found . over two years, relapse rates were 44 per cent in the mbct group compared to 47 per cent in the medication group . this suggests it offers an 'alternative treatment' for those averse to drugs .

experts believe the molalla log cabin could have been built as early as 1795 - a decade before lewis and clark reached the pacific ocean . the way the logs are tightly interwoven, secured without nails and leaving no gaps to fill, is similar to russian log cabins of the same time period, when catherine the great was sending envoys to alaska to boost the fur trade . the way the logs are tightly interwoven, secured without nails and leaving no gaps to fill, is unlike pioneer building methods at the time .

tests carried out in combination with chemotherapy drugs achieved almost complete remission in mice . scientists used low doses of the drug oxaliplatin, which has a unique ability to activate cancer-killing immune cells in small tumours but works less well in large, aggressive tumours . each year in the uk around 41,000 men are diagnosed with prostate cancer and 11,000 die from the disease .

nearly 3.8million crimes recorded by police last year, up 2% from 2013 . a record number of rapes and other sex crimes were logged – up 32% . experts say the rise was partly because victims were 'more willing' to report sex crimes, including historical ones, and police were more likely to take complaints seriously . number of murders and manslaughter cases in england and wales has fallen to its lowest level for 38 years .
social services minister scott morrison says the government is actively researching possible legislation changes . the national immunisation program currently outlines that parents must vaccinate their children to be eligible for family payments and childcare rebates . but people who choose not to vaccinate their children for philosophical, personal or religious beliefs are able to apply for an exemption . mr morrison believes there is essentially no excuse to excuse a parent when they decide not to vaccinate their child .

in 1986, reactor 4 in the chernobyl power plant exploded sending radioactive particles into the air above the city of pripyat, north of kiev . the exclusion zone, a nearly 50km (31-mile) radius of contamination, runs around the plant . visitors are banned from touching anything, eating or drinking any food or drink that does not come from outside the zone . however, day trips - and even overnight stays - are permitted, now that radiation levels have decreased .

the tiny nipper - measuring just 5.5 inches long - was caught during a 2010 government research trip . this week scientists revealed the dinky creature is a pocket shark - a miniature variation of the more popular kinds . the young male is the second of its species ever seen . the first pocket shark was found 36 years ago in the pacific ocean off the coast of peru and it's been sitting in a russian museum since .

linear dunes, like these captured by nasa's landsat 7 satellite, are straight ridges of sand that have been known to measure as long as 99 miles (160km) the image was spotted by io9 and the colours were caused as rays of sunlight hit the sand and were reflected off . dunes have also been known to merge and form so-called 'y-shaped compound dunes' .

the glass house in chislehurst, south east london, was built as a bunker for civil servants in the event of a nuclear attack in 1951 . the house was built with five foot thick concrete walls and a wooden area afforded it secrecy . it fell into disrepair in the years following the end of the cold war but has now been transformed into a luxury home . the property also boasts five bedrooms, a stylish kitchen, games room and a roof terrace .

the uss independence was scuttled in january 1951 during weapons testing near california's farallon islands . researchers went looking for it again in march as part of a project to map about 300 wrecks in and around the gulf of the farallones national marine sanctuary . sonar images show what looks to be an airplane on one of the elevators that took planes from the hangar deck to its flight deck .

money collected from students at the university of surrey was submerged in agar - a substance that allows bacteria to grow quickly . it was then monitored for three to four days for colonies of bacteria . most of the bacteria found on the coins studied was harmless bacillus mycoides, which is common in soil . but mrsa and food poisoning bacteria have been found on money in previous studies .

fergus simpson from university of barcelona applied a mathematical formula to assume aliens obey the same laws of conservation of energy as animals do on earth . larger animals need more resources to survive, so are less common than plentiful ants, for example . he said there must be a minimum size needed for intelligent life, based on the range of body sizes of intelligent animals such as apes and humans, found on earth .

adidas has partnered with spotify to create an app that tracks your speed . called adidas go, the songs are additionally selected based on the runner's musical interests and listening history . the app uses the phone's accelerometer to track the user's stride . it then searches for songs in the spotify library with matching beats per minute . songs are played in full but users can skip tracks if they want to .
scientists from the uk and portugal looked at 477 anatomical features across 81 individual dinosaurs found in museums throughout europe and us . they used a 'specimen-based protocol' to analyse each individual animal . this allowed them to look at differences within each species, as well as between species . brontosaurus is now sufficiently different from apatosaurus to deserve its own genus name .

the research focused on pomc neurons, which are a structure called the hypothalamus, that send and receive signals to regulate appetite . when pomc neurons are absent, or not working properly, animals and humans grow dangerously obese . the new findings show in animals that the same thing happens when certain genetic triggers inside the pomc cells aren't working .

biologist dr joe hanson says a human molecule might contain 375 million atoms of hydrogen, 132 million atoms of oxygen and 85 million atoms of carbon . by comparison, this human molecule contains just one atom of cobalt and three molecules of the metal molybdenum . dr hanson claims his formula only represents the chemical make up of the human body at birth .

'digital seasoning' also applies to wine, helping drinkers enjoy their tipple by up to 15 per cent more, if served alongside the right music .

researchers studied stone tools used by people in the early ahmarian culture and the protoaurignacian culture, living in south and west europe and west asia around 40,000 years ago . they found the human tools were no more effective than neanderthal-created weapons of the same era . researchers say the discovery means we may need to rethink the reasons humans survived neanderthals - and that we may not have behaved as differently as we thought .

technology is based on a technique known as 'neuromodulation' in which electricity from a chip stimulates the nervous system to restore sight . surgeon first implants a small silicon chip with 150 electrodes on the retina . when the patient puts on the system's dark glasses, an integrated video camera sends images to a portable computer . a connected 'pocket processor' converts that recording into an infrared image, which the goggles will then beam into the eye .

geraldine alcorn, 29, of pittsburgh, waived a preliminary hearing on wednesday on a felony charge that she interfered with the girl's legal custody . prosecutors allege alcorn encrypted her phone number on the girl's math homework, exchanged thousands of text messages with her and even talked of adopting and running away with the girl . the girl's mother, a single parent, complained to school officials after finding out alcorn had visited the girl at their home while the mother was working .
pound fell to near 1.46 against the us dollar, its lowest level since june 2010 . different polls have variously put the tories and labour narrowly ahead . experts have warned of impact on economy of badly hung parliament .
inverness beat celtic 3-2 in the scottish cup final on sunday . josh meekings stopped a leigh griffiths header during the game . the defender was banned for one game for deliberate handball . a judicial panel tribunal threw out his ban on thursday .
andreas lubitz, 27, crashed his germanwings plane into the alps on march 24 . investigators believe he locked his captain out of the cockpit and deliberately crashed the plane, killing all 150 people on board . tablet computer found at his apartment reveals he used internet search terms such as cockpit doors and their security, and suicide methods . revelations came hours after it was reported that lubitz told doctors he was on sick leave rather than flying .
the 20-year-old woman was driving on the i-25 in weld county, north of denver, when her window shattered and she felt bleeding from both sides of her neck . she was taken to hospital where surgeons found she had been shot clean through the neck . the bullet did not damage the woman's airway or sever any major blood vessels .
fulham drew 1-1 with rotherham at st james' park on saturday . matt derbyshire opened the scoring for the millers . ross mccormack equalised for fulham .
hector morejon, 19, was shot by a police officer, who allegedly thought the 19-year-old was pointing a gun at him during a trespassing and vandalism incident . his mother, lucia morejon, was at home when she heard the shots . she went to an alley near her home to see what happened and then realized it was her son in the ambulance .
the slants are an asian-american band from portland, oregon, who pay homage to the '80s on stage . the u.s. patent and trademark office decided that "slant" was disparaging to asians, and denied them a trademark registration . lz granderson: this isn't the first time someone has "taken back" a marginalizing term in a trademark fight .
survivors gathered at the site of the former bergen-belsen concentration camp to mark the 70th anniversary of its liberation . more than 72,000 camp inmates and prisoners of war died at the concentration camp including diarist anne frank and her older sister margot . hundreds of people sobbed as they laid flowers and flags as memorials . german president joachim gauck said the british soldiers who liberated the camp were 'ambassadors of a democratic culture'
spitfire p9374 was among the first built in march 1940 but never made it to the battle of britain as it crashed over dunkirk in may 1940 . the fighter plane was being piloted by flying officer peter cazenove when it was hit by a single bullet from a german dornier bomber . casenove was captured by the nazis and taken to the stalag luft iii prisoner of war camp . in 1980 the wreckage was discovered when part of it was spotted poking out from its sandy grave
tianwen chen, 65, and his wife gairen guo, 60, have adopted 40 children . they found their first child in a box on the roadside in 1989 . gradually took more and more disabled children into their home . but the couple are only now living comfortably with 12 of the children .

when a star reaches its white dwarf stage, nearly all of the material from the star is packed inside a radius one hundredth that of the original star . gravity at the surface of a white dwarf is over ten thousand times higher than the gravity at the surface of the sun .
senior constable neale mcshane is set to retire from his decade long post in birdsville, which borders on the simpson desert in far south-west queensland . the 59-year-old has spent 40 years as an officer in three different states . temperatures in the region can reach over 50 degrees, giving rise to a number of desert rescues that mcshane must execute every year .
the fbi is investigating a possible isis-inspired terrorist threat in the united states . it's not clear whether the threat is real or aspirational .

in 84 days from november 2013 to january 2014, the area around azle, texas, shook with 27 magnitude two or greater earthquakes . scientists believe these earthquakes were the result of high-pressure injection of drilling wastewater into the ground . this adds to other studies that linked injecting wastewater from energy wells to a tremendous jump in earthquakes in oklahoma and southern kansas .

magnitude 3.1 earthquake caused a 'sharp jolt' to be felt north of los angeles . quake was centered four miles north of san fernando near interstate 210 . jolt was felt widely in the san fernando valley and parts of northern los angeles county .
england have been drawn with the republic of ireland, holland and italy . john peacock's young lions are the defending european champions . scotland have been placed in group c alongside greece, russia and france . the tournament will take place in the east bulgarian venues of burgas, sozopol, sliven and stara zagora between may 6 and 22 .
dale and debra krein of rogue river, oregon, filed a lawsuit in 2012 against their neighbors and their giant tibetan mastiffs . the kreins claimed their neighbors' dogs have caused them more than a decade of disquiet by barking until 5am . a jury ruled that the canines should be debarked within 60 days .
vladmir lenin was behind the bolshevik take-over of power in russia in 1917 . his remains were embalmed on stalin's orders when he died aged 53 in 1924 . they were kept on display in moscow apart from a period in the second world war . a team known as the 'mausoleum group' has developed techniques to maintain the look and feel of the communist revolutionary's corpse . they brag that their technique has been the result of almost a century of fine-tuning
police officer michael rapiejko rammed his car into armed robbery suspect mario valencia in marana, arizona on february 19 . dash cam footage showed rapiejko mounting the curb and mowing down valencia . valencia remained in hospital for two days before being booked into jail .
rurik jutting, a british banker, is charged with two counts of murder in hong kong . police say jutting called them to an upmarket apartment in the middle of wan chai . there they found a woman lying on the blood-splattered floor, police say . during a search of the apartment, officers uncovered another body hidden in a suitcase .
patties foods has found no link between its nanna's brand frozen mixed berries and a national hepatitis a outbreak . the company said no hepatitis a virus or e.coli were detected in any sample of its recalled and non-recalled product during its own testing . hepatitis a is spread when traces of faecal matter containing the virus come in contact with hands, water or food and then enters a person's mouth .
ciara campbell, 43, accused of spying on ex-partner pc stuart swarbrick 200 times . court heard she also spied on pc swarbrick's new girlfriend 50 times . campbell denies three counts of unlawfully obtaining personal data .
brian rogers and caitlin mcguire own the breckenridge cannabis club, a recreational marijuana dispensary . colorado became the first state in the nation to allow the sale of recreational marijuana . rogers and mcguire's journey to build a legal marijuana empire is documented in the new cnn original series "high profits"
labour attempted to rebuff a letter criticising the party by publishing its own message calling for a labour government signed by people ‘from all walks of life’ . the signatories, who said they were ‘all working people’, warned about the ‘proliferation of zero-hours contracts’ they claimed were ‘letting down britain’ . but within hours the plan was in chaos as it was found the signatories included a benefit fraudster, trade unionists and the cigar-smoking children of millionaires .
leeds rhinos defeated castleford rhinos 26-12 at mend-a-hose jungle . kevin sinfield has retired from super league football . rhinos captain will switch codes at the end of 2015 .
miracle godson, 13, jumped into deep waters at east quarry, wigan . friends desperately tried to save him but his lifeless body was found . lancashire police say his death is not being treated as suspicious .
chris smalling has signed a three-year contract extension at manchester united . the england defender had been linked with a move to arsenal . smalling has become a regular for louis van gaal this season .

floriane de lassee has captured the essence of what people do when they're alone in cities across the world . in her project, inside views, she spots movement in the standstill of the night . de lassee has been photographing the cities of insomnia for at least ten years .
californian farmers are digging ever-deeper bore holes to keep the rest of us stocked up with all-year-round peaches, sweet peppers and pistachios . global demand for the nut is soaring as customers from david cameron to millions of middle-class chinese develop a passion for almond-based foods . almonds have become california’s second biggest agricultural commodity after milk, as demand has exploded by 1,000 per cent in a decade .

chinese scientists have admitted to changing the genes of human embryos . the announcement confirms rumors that some researchers have been conducting ethically questionable genetic experiments . some scientists have already reacted with horror at the idea, for fear it could be misused to allow parents to 'select' the genes they will pass on to their grandchildren . the team tried to tweak the gene responsible for  ⁇ -thalassaemia, a potentially deadly blood disorder, using a germ line editing technique known as crispr/cas9 .

train was traveling through salters pond road and highway 121, near trenton . it derailed after apparently hitting a tree that had fallen onto the tracks . at time, train was carrying nitrogen-based chemical anhydrous ammonia . it was also transporting non-hazardous ammonia nitrate, which can form explosive mixtures with air . derailment caused up to 15 cars to overturn and leak, officials said . no one was injured in the crash, and residents and businesses were evacuated .

betheny coyne, 24, was born with a heart condition known as coarctation of the aorta . condition causes it difficult for the heart to pump blood around the body due to a narrowed aorta - the main artery that leaves the left side of the heart . she was warned each pregnancy could have placed so much extra strain on her heart that she would die . but she defied medical predictions and is now mother to three healthy children .

almond growers in california are at the centre of a row over water usage during one of the worst droughts in decades . the state supplies more than three-quarters of the world's $4.93billion(£3.3bn) almond market . this has also seen local residents attack the bottled water industry . an online petition demanding that the company seizes production of bottled water in california has garnered more than 150,000 signatures .

the house judiciary committee on thursday overwhelmingly passed the latest version of a bill known as the usa freedom act . it seeks to codify president barack obama's proposal to end the nsa's collection of domestic calling records . it would allow the agency to request certain records held by the telephone companies under a court order in terrorism investigations . the authority to collect those records and other related surveillance provisions of the patriot act will expire june 1 unless congress passes a law reauthorizing it .

us researchers claim that exact prices of goods on ebay attract higher offers than round numbers . sellers who end their price with ‘00’ typically receive offers that are five to eight per cent lower than those with more specific prices . when the posted initial price is of a round number, like $1,000, the average counteroffer is much lower than if it is a non-round number, like $1,079 .

in 1995, there were more than 154 million migrants who left their home country and moved to another for various reasons . in 2013, that number had risen to 231 million globally, and 7.8 million reside in the uk . great britain and northern ireland are among the nations which have a high number of immigrants, with more than 7.8 million . meanwhile, the u.s. has more than 45 million immigrants - the most of all nations - and russia has more than 11 million .

vulcan aerospace will look after the space programs of stratolaunch systems . this includes an ambitious project to launch spacecraft and probes into orbit from of a huge carrier aircraft with a wingspan of 385ft (117 metres) the plane will climb to 30,000 feet and launch a rocket at high altitude, avoiding the huge fuel costs of launching from earth . initially, the system is intended to deliver satellites weighing up to about 13,500lbs (6,124 kg) into orbits between 112 miles and 1,243 miles .

kate roberts noticed her son miles had a slightly different shaped head when he was born . at three months he was diagnosed with flat head syndrome . this is where the back of the head becomes flattened, causing the head to widen and the front of the skull to bulge out . doctors believe it is caused by babies sleeping on their backs . as it is not medically dangerous, the nhs does not pay for treatment . instead, parents are advised to move their children on to their stomachs during the day .

study found youngsters more likely to engage in risky behaviour when parents distracted by texting or talking on the phone . researchers observed randomly selected parents with children aged 18 months to five years old at playgrounds in new york . they measured factors such as adult’s level of engagement with child and how distracted they seemed . researchers also observed how often child took risks such as jumping off moving swings or going down a slide head-first .

new diet could more than halve a person's risk of alzheimer's disease . includes three daily servings of wholegrains and salad – along with an extra vegetable and a glass of wine . lowered the risk of alzheimer's by 53 per cent in those who stuck to the diet rigidly . for those that followed it moderately well, it lowered the risk by about 35 per cent .

two-hour real-time documentary follows canalboat as it pootles its way along a picturesque stretch of the kennet and avon canal . there is no presenter, narrator, dialogue or music, so all viewers will hear are the sounds of the boat's engine, the lapping of the water and the local birdsong . the film was shot on a sunny day last month and will air on may 5 as part of the bbc four goes slow series of deliberately unrushed programmes .

drunkards were banned from every boozer in birmingham at the turn of the century for a string of crimes including drink-driving and riding a horse while drunk . they were placed on the 1904 blacklist after four convictions under the inebriates act of 1898 . the list was then sent to landlords who were not allowed to sell them alcohol . each drunkard’s entry includes photographs, their name, alias, residence, employment, distinguishing marks, nature of conviction and the sentence received .

youtuber dave hax’s clever new kitcken trick lets cooks peel potatoes without using a peeler . the process starts by running the blade of a sharp knife carefully around the middle of the potato, without letting it cut through the flesh . mr hax, whose youtube channel demonstrates various life hacks, devised the method which results in perfectly peeled potatoes .

tewksbury police department came under attack by criminals in december . they encrypted their computers' files using a form of internet malware . the program called cryptolocker infects through an e-mail and then scrambles the data on the computer . the only files that were not corrupted were 18 months old . cops were forced to pay the ransom in the untraceable digital currency .

holmesburg prison in philadelphia, pennsylvania, was one of the most notorious and violent prisons in american history . since its construction in 1895, its high walls housed some of the country's most dangerous criminals whose uprisings ended in death and mass-injury . haunting images which emerged in 2011 proved that government doctors used the jail to test chemical substances on inmates and disabled american citizens .

researchers at joint base lewis-mcchord in tacoma, washington, looked at military records of 3.9million personnel who served after 9/11 . they concluded that military suicides may be more likely after members leave the service than during active duty deployment . service members with a dishonorable discharge were about twice as likely to commit suicide as those who had an honorable separation .

'sadly', they say, 'only' 70 per cent of speaking roles in films are also given to men, and women 'get to be naked' in movies twice as often as men do .

biologists studied the healing process at a molecular level using electron microscopes to examine skin as it repairs itself . they found skin cells appear to attach to each other using tiny tubes that then pull them together so they interlock together like a zip . findings could help in the development of new treatments for wounds that could speed up the healing process .

palaeontologists are referring to chilesaurus diegosuarezi as a 'platypus' dinosaur because of its bizarre combination of characteristics . features include its small skull and feet, which are similar to those seen on long-neck dinosaurs . the dinosaur belongs to the theropod group of dinosaurs - which includes the famous meat eaters velociraptor, carnotaurus and tyrannosaurus . theropods were previously only known in close relatives of birds .

scientists at massachusetts general hospital and harvard medical school have developed a device that clips onto the camera of a smartphone . it uses powerful cameras and tiny beads that bind to cancerous cells . when added to a tissue or blood sample, these microbeads alter the way light is scattered by the sample . they produce distinctive diffraction patterns in the image if clumped together . the results can be sent to a central computer for analysis in 45 minutes .
the irs' overloaded phone system hung up on more than eight million taxpayers this filing season as the agency cut millions of dollars from customer services . for those who weren't disconnected, only 40percent actually got through to a person . many of those people had to wait on hold for more than 30 minutes, irs commissioner john koskinen said wednesday . the agency's budget has been cut by $1.2 billion since 2010 .

tokyo researchers have proposed a laser system to attach to the iss . it would be used to shoot down pieces of debris in earth orbit . the system would have a range of 62 miles (100km) and could target things less than 0.4 inches (1cm) in size . powerful pulses from the laser would then push space junk into earth’s atmosphere, where it would burn up . this would create a force that reduced its velocity, causing it to fall into earth’s atmosphere and burn up .

david crossley, 63, from birmingham, developed kidney stones last year . one in ten people will develop a kidney stone, and the numbers are rising . they are the result of waste products in the blood forming crystals inside the kidneys, which eventually build up into a solid lump . they start causing pain - known as renal colic - once they travel down the ureter, the narrow tube that carries urine from the kidney to the bladder .

hayley okines suffered from the rare disease progeria which ages body at eight times the normal rate . progeria involves a mutant protein called progerin that accelerates physical ageing . there are around 74 known cases of the disease around the world and only four in the uk . a 10 year old progeria child will have the appearance of an octogenarian with symptoms including baldness, arthritis and heart problems .

two-up is legal on anzac day across returned servicemen league clubs (rsl) and pubs . the game dates back to australia's goldfields and the first recorded games are believed to have taken place in the late 1790s . on saturday as aussies commemorated the centenary of the landing at gallipoli, thousands of men and women took their chances with the coin game . while the game is considered a form of gambling and is illegal at all other times, two-up is allowed on anzac day across pubs .

builders in turkey have accidentally found one of the largest underground cities in the otherworldly region of cappadocia . the city lies beneath the nevşehir fortress and the surrounding area, which was being excavated during a construction project . it is thought to be the biggest underground city in cappadocia, consisting of 3.5 miles of tunnels, secret churches, tombs and safe havens . the find is similar to the discovery of another underground city, derinkuyu, which was made in 1963 .

german researchers have shown that passive smoking affects plants too . plants can take up nicotine from contaminated soil and plumes of smoke . finding may explain why some spices, herbal teas and medicinal plants have high concentrations of nicotine in them . nicotine was frequently used as an insecticide until it was banned by the european union in 2009 because of its toxicity .

study looked at the voting habits of twins born in the uk . aim was to explore how much nature and nurture influence our party political allegiances and potential voting preferences . identical twins share 100 per cent of their genes, while non-identical twins - like non-twin siblings - share about 50 per cent . twin studies are useful for exploring whether a trait is forged in the genes, passed down or by the environment a person is living in .

scientists at vanderbilt university in tennessee urged parents to take steps to eradicate the risk of surgical-site infections . they swabbed stuffed animals brought into hospital by children ahead of surgery . all those soft toys swabbed showed bacterial growth . a single wash and dry cycle at home, followed by sealing the toy in a plastic bag for 24 hours effectively 'sterilised' 79 per cent of those soft toys tested .

a 'blob' of warm water 2,000 miles across is sitting in the pacific ocean . since last june it has extended from alaska to mexico . it has been present since 2013 and causing fish to seek shelter elsewhere . and a new university of washington study says it could be responsible for droughts . it found that a high-pressure ridge could be causing the blob, by trapping heat in the water . this could explain why california is experiencing its worst ever drought .

dante gabriel rossetti's muse fanny cornforth died in 1909 at the age of 74 . she was born sarah cox in 1835 and was considered one of his 'stunners' she went on to pose for at least 60 of his artworks . details of where and how she died remained a mystery for years . her biographer recently tracked her down through hospital records . they revealed she died in the sussex county asylum in poverty and suffering from clear symptoms of dementia .

bizarre formation was photographed by amateur astronomer gordon ewen . sun spots range in size from 10 miles (16km) to 100,000 miles (160,000km) wide . each one can be more than ten times the size of our planet .

nestle has released an archive of images showing the evolution of the easter egg over the past 40 years . the collection includes eggs by much-loved brands like caramac, yorkie, rolo, toffee crisp, aero and even polo . easter eggs can be traced back to the years following the first world war when eggs symbolised new life and hope .
small, sooty particles, mostly caused by fumes and factory emissions, alter the structure of the brain . particles have previously been shown to cause lung damage and harmful changes in blood vessels and clotting . us researchers found evidence that living near congested roads or polluted areas can lead to ‘silent strokes’ which in turn cause shrinkage of the brain .

biosure hiv self test enables people to test themselves when and where they like . an estimated 26,000 people in the uk have hiv but are unaware of it . tests use a small amount of blood from a finger-prick sample to detect hiv antibodies, giving a result in just 15 minutes . founder brigette bard said it is a significant step towards normalising hiv testing .

psychologists from goldsmiths university in london and ohio state university studied more than 13,000 twins aged nine to 16 from six countries . they found that 40 to 50 per cent of the differences in children’s motivation to learn could be explained by their genetic inheritance from their parents . the twins’ shared environment - elements such as the teachers and the family that they had in common - would be a larger factor than genetics . genetics and non-shared-environment factors had the largest effect on the children’s motivation to learn .

this is according to sean raymond, an astrophysicist with the laboratoire d'astrophysique de bordeaux in france . a planet needs to keep warm for liquid water to form, and without the sun, this heat would have to come from its interior . a layer of ice on a planet's surface can act as a strong insulator, locking in a planet's heat .

llallawavis scagliai has been named after argentina's naturalist galileo juan scaglia . palaeontologists say it is the most complete skeleton of a 'terror bird' they say it would have had powerful jaws but limited hearing . it was so well preserved that scientists have been able to study part of the bird's auditory system and its trachae . while it had a terrifying apperance, its hearing was probably below average compared to birds living today .

scientists at queen mary university of london have found bite marks on the fossilised skull of a juvenile daspletosaurus, which lived around 75 million years ago . some of the injuries appear to have been sustained during combat with other tyrannosaurs, but others appear to have occurred after death . scientists believe another daspletosaurus, which could grow to nine metres (30ft) as adults and weigh up to four tons, fed on the youngster's body .

bae system's typhoon is so accurate even the movements of the tide can disrupt the jet fighter's positioning and accuracy . it is built on 'floating' concrete rafts that move in sync with the moon . these rafts measure 59ft (18 metres) long and 9.8ft (3 metres) thick . this helps its ‘fly by wire’ computer system to accurately control the aircraft, designed to be unstable but hugely agile .

report suggests carbon dioxide produced by fossil fuels could be captured and used to produce the fizz in cola . many nations are looking into carbon capture and storage (ccs) technologies as a way to cut their greenhouse house emissions . ccs refers to the process of capturing carbon released by burning fossil fuels and storing it in porous rock layers in areas such as depleted oil and gas reservoirs . but there are concerns over storing such huge amounts of carbon underground .

bones found in gough's cave in somerset had flesh cut from them before being chewed and crushed . archaeologists say the findings suggest people living in the late ice age indulged in ritual cannibalism, perhaps as a macabre way to revere their dead kin . stone age farmers in italy cut the flesh from the bones of their dead before burying them, a recent study found .

thousands of velella velella are washing up across oregon, california and washington after strong winds blew them onto the shore . they have a small sail on their bodies, which means they are easily blown to shore . the creatures are not harmful to humans but will smell fishy as they decompose .

the optimal case was designed by israel-based amited . sensors in the case monitor the phone's temperature . if it gets too hot, optimal will cool the device using two micro-fans . and if it gets too cold, optimal engages its anti-freeze protection mode to gently heat the phone using resistance coils . it syncs with a smartphone over bluetooth and constantly analyses the phone's temperature when auto mode is enabled .

cremated bone was discovered during excavations ahead of a new pipeline in landford, essex and is thought to date to 5,600 bc . it was placed into a pit with a diameter of about three feet (one metre) and then backfilled with soil . three radiocarbon dates, two from bone fragments and one from charcoal, have confirmed the remains are around 7,614 years old .

two four-year pilot culls in somerset and gloucestershire should be completed by trapping the badgers in cages and shooting them, says the bva . it concluded that the first two years of culling had not demonstrated conclusively that ‘controlled shooting’ of free-running badgers could be effective and humane . animal welfare campaigners welcomed the news but said the bva’s ongoing support for cage-trapping and shooting was ‘regrettable’ .

martin burgess clock b is based on john harrison's 18th century clock . he thought it up to solve problem of determining longitude at sea . clock has been part of 100-day trial at royal observatory, in greenwich . it was initially set ticking a year ago but it quickly became apparent trial would be a success and wax seals were placed on case . clock has since been certified by guinness world records .

stormy weather system formed in the tasman sea hasn't hit nsw this strong since 2007 . east coast lows are particularly common in june and tend to be more frequent in autumn and winter . they are characterised by gales or storm force winds that can damage buildings, fell trees and powerlines . they can also cause powerful surf that can damage the coast and, in some cases, run ships aground .

national radio astronomy observatory is objecting to proposals by irobot to release a radio wave-guided lawnmower . it claims irobot's machines will interfere with its sensitive radio telescopes which astronomers are using to pick up signs of alien life . the frequency band proposed for the lawnbot is 6240-6740 mhz - the same one several large radio telescopes operate on . irobot says its vision is to create lawnmowers guided wirelessly from beacons on poles stuck into the lawn .

sydney’s dwelling values rose by 5.8 per cent in the last quarter bringing the average house price to $690,000 . it's a record growth and the strongest increase since april in 2009 . the reserve bank cut official interest rates to 2.25 per cent in february leading to a weekly 80 per cent auction clearance rate . sydney's performance drove the quarterly national dwelling value to heighten by 3 per cent . brisbane, adelaide and perth suffered significant declines over the quarter .

calbuco volcano suddenly sprung into life at 6pm yesterday in southern chile . two massive explosions shot billions of cubic metres of ash into atmosphere . ash covered nearby towns and villages, caking localities in mounds of soot . first eruption in over four decades sent vast clouds of dust more than six miles into the air, creating an incredible display of lightning and lava against night's sky . another unexpected eruption in los lagos region today heightened fears of local waters becoming contaminated and more flights being grounded .

red wine is red because of pigments known as anthocyanins, which are alcohol soluble . when higher concentrations of clear alcohol are poured onto the stain, the colours dissolve into the liquid rather than drying into the carpet . the video was created by the washington-based american chemical society as part of its reactions series .

hair follicles are rich in stem cells - cells that never lose the capacity to renew themselves - which help the skin heal . a bald scalp is less able to cope with nicks, cuts and bruising because of the lack of healthy follicles . removing hair through shaving or waxing won't reduce these benefits because the hair follicles are still intact .

some owners of the apple watch have found that it malfunctions if worn on tattooed wrists . some dark, vibrant ink seems to cause the watch’s heart sensor to lose connection and give inaccurate readings . this is because the heart sensor reads a pulse by measuring light absorption through the skin - a process called photoplethysmography . apple has yet to comment on the issue, despite speculation that the apparent fault could also stop some people using apple pay .

the study compared its results to the most severe emissions scenarios outlined by the intergovernmental panel on climate change (ipcc) it claims variability is caused by interactions between the ocean and atmosphere, and other natural factors . these 'wiggles' can slow or speed the rate of warming from decade to decade, and exaggerate or offset the effects of increases in greenhouse gas concentrations . because these 'climate wiggles' were not accounted for, the duke university researchers say the report may have been an over-interpretation of short-term temperature trends .

the castle at zhangjiakou, in china's northern hebei province, was known as the ming dynasty's 'martial city' it was built in 1393 and protected by an imposing 12-metre wall that struck fear into opposing armies . archaeologists have begun a daunting project to restore the fortress to its former glory . restoration work will see building work completed in the original ming dynasty style of architecture .
shares in what is now called the bg group rose by nearly 30 per cent to 1,153p . the rise came after the oil giant royal dutch shell announced plans to buy bg group in a £47billion deal . news of the deal has driven up the price of shares in bg now owned by people who originally bought british gas shares in 1986 .
northern territory’s chief minister adam giles made the threat after a recent rise in youth crime in alice springs . parents will also be fined $298 if their child is found on the streets during school hours . on monday night, 42 people were taken into protective custody and 34 young people were driven home after a group of 50 young people threw ‘large rocks’ at police .
international monetary fund predicts uk economy will grow by 2.7% this year . beaten only by the united states with inflation at zero per cent . low oil prices are expected to help bolster steady growth in the uk .
spanish researchers say climate change impacted human migration . until 1.4 million years ago it was too cold to inhabit southeast spain . but then the climate warmed to 13°c (55°f) and became more humid . this enabled hominins - our distant ancestors - to move to new regions . they lived on a diet of tiger nuts, worms and grasshoppers, according to research . but as conditions warmed, they were able to spread across europe .
david and margaret-ann rous were on an easter getaway in the scottish highlands . they had arranged a secret visit using mr rous's light aircraft to see family . but when the couple failed to turn up at the island's airstrip, a search party was scrambled . wreckage of the plane and the couple's bodies were found in hills in argyll .
residents from fairdale, an unincorporated town 80 miles northwest of chicago, were told they could return to their homes on saturday to salvage what they could . but buildings in the settlement were virtually flattened when the vortex slammed into the area at around 7pm on thursday night . officials reported that 17 of the 50 buildings in the town are completely destroyed, while the other 33 have all been damaged in some way .
just 8p in every £10 spent on dementia research goes on research . outlay on stroke research is little better, with 19p allocated from each £10 . despite extra cash pumped into the two diseases they remain underfunded . cancer research is 13 times higher than dementia and six times more than stroke .

john and carolyn jackson, of mount holly, new york, are currently on trial for abusing their three foster children . the abuse occurred between 2005 and 2010 and left the foster children with broken bones and numerous other health problems . one of their biological children reported the abuse to someone outside the family . the jacksons' first trial was ruled a mistrial when a prosecutor inadvertently mentioned the death of one of the children .

shibuya ward will issue "partnership certificates" for same-sex couples . certificates will allow them some of the rights of married heterosexual couples . proponents of marriage equality in conservative japan say the move is a step in the right direction .
researchers subjected lithium-ion batteries to heat and used thermal imaging and non-invasive high speed imaging techniques to observe changes in their internal structure . copper inside melted, indicating temperatures of at least 1,085°c (1,985°f) and it caused molten material to stream from the battery’s vent . the footage is the first time the failure of li-ion batteries due to overheating has been recorded . li-ion batteries are vulnerable to a condition known as thermal runaway .

ambulance crews in london answered 2,333 calls between 2am and 3am . busiest hour was between 2am and 3am when 638 calls were received . busiest hour was between 2am and 3am when 638 calls were received . scotland yard had 3,000 officers on duty at both street level and on podiums .
'goblins' are scientifically known as 'hoodoos' - rock protrusions consisting of relatively soft rock topped by harder stone . the softer rock has been removed by wind and water, leaving thousands of unique constructions . at under five square miles, goblin valley is tiny compared to nearby parks such as the nearby 527 square metre canyonlands .
in 2018, nasa will launch the orion spacecraft using the largest, most powerful rocket booster ever built . tucked inside the stage adapter will be 11 self-contained small satellites, each about the size of a large shoebox . the first is a near-earth asteroid (nea) scout, using solar sail propulsion, will fly by a small asteroid, taking pictures and making observations . lunar flashlight will scout for locations on the lunar surface that are rich in resources that could be used in future exploration

scientists at gillette have spent nine years studying how to get the perfect shave . they cut real skin samples and then attempted to rip them by pulling them apart . using x-ray beams they were able to observe microscopic changes that take place in skin to help it resist tearing . they discovered curly fibers of collagen that make up dermis of the skin straighten and stretch in response to a tear to share the load and prevent further damage .
german discounter has won increasing share of the market since the recession . it now lags behind only the ‘big four’ - tesco, asda, sainsbury’s, morrisons . major supermarkets have slashed prices in recent months to fend off competition from cut-price rivals such as aldi and lidl .

the question, 'so when is cheryl’s birthday?' was one of 25 questions set in the singapore and asian schools math olympiad . at first, it appears impossible to answer without more information . but those who were able to reason their way to this answer followed a series of logical steps that allowed them to rule out the other dates .

esa's asteroid impact mission, or aim, launched in october 2020 . aim will travel to a binary asteroid system – the paired didymos asteroids, which will come a comparatively close 11 million km to earth in 2022 . aim will also put down a lander – esa's first touchdown on a small body since rosetta's philae landed on a comet last november .

the automated planet finder (apf) consists of a 2.4-metre automated telescope and enclosure, and a high-resolution spectrograph . the spectrograph takes starlight from the telescope and spreads it into a rainbow of colours, splitting the spectrum into thousands of different wavelengths . apf observes them every night for months, in search of rocky planets with very low masses, similar to earth .
the gr20 trail, which runs down the mountainous spine of corsica, happens to be the toughest trek in europe . the ancient sentiers de transhumance footpaths used for more than 1,000 years by shepherds leading their animals to summer pastures . most of the trails were clearly marked with orange daubs of paint and equipped with maps and detailed instructions .

after a heavy night of drinking, your immune system is bound to be weaker . this is because your body is under oxidative stress - a process that can also happen after smoking, breathing in pollution and even sunbathing . higher doses of vitamin e, found in foods such as kale and almonds, can mitigate the stress on immune cells .

pakistan had almost completely eradicated polio, a devastating disease which paralyses its victims' legs but is preventable with a simple injection . today, it's on the rise again after the taliban declared the vaccine to be a 'western conspiracy' and a 'bio-weapon' that would actually make children sick . but mother-of-three farhina touseef is risking her life by leading a team of medics as they travel door-to-door through dangerous taliban strongholds .
grey seals have been spied feasting on harbour porpoises off the coast of wales . on four separate occasions, they have been spotted feasting on the porpoises . the footage, the first in the world, was shot by a wildlife cruise company . it backs up a recent study that grey seals have a penchant for young porpoises with a thick layer of energy-packed fat . and that far from scavenging on dead animals, they attack healthy creatures .

the edwardian-style building and shopfront on brunswick street in fitzroy was once owned by wei tang who was convicted in 2006 of keeping five thai women as sex slaves . the brothel, formerly known as club 417, has six bedrooms each with its own shower or spa, as well as a large lounge with a bar and a sitting room . the brothel is currently between a t-shirt shop and television repair company .
the victims of a horrific medical experiment run by the united states in guatemala are now suing johns hopkins university . the lawsuit, which has 750 plaintiffs and includes victims and their families, is seeking $1billion . plaintiffs claim that officials from hopkins approved and helped to plan the study, which ran from 1945 to 1956 . in the aftermath of the experiment, some individuals died of syphilis, while those who survived claim they passed the disease down to their children .
276 girls were abducted from their school by boko haram militants last year . unicef have revealed that more than 200 of the girls remain in captivity . children as young as four are being used within the ranks of boko haram . they are being trained to fight, forced to be suicide bombers or sold as sex slaves .
scientists have found deep water gas hydrates in the arctic that are reservoirs for abiotic methane – a gas 20 times more effective in trapping heat than carbon dioxide . the gas forms through a process called serpentinisation . serpentinisation occurs when seawater reacts with hot mantle rocks exhumed along large faults within the seafloor . scientists don't believe the formations will impact climate change . instead, they say similar formations could someday be used to store methane, that can later be used as fuel .
linda macdonald, 55, from shelburne, massachusetts was arrested monday night in dummerston, vermont . macdonald crashed her 2011 toyota camry into a wooden fence . she posted a .10 blood-alcohol content - above the state's legal threshold of .08 .

pensions office worker sent out letter asking for £3,351,978,728,190,661 . the bill is more than a thousands times germany's annual gdp . it is enough to pay the uk government debt nearly 2,000 times over .
the first comprehensive picture of how neurons connect to one another found local networks of neurons layered like the shells in a russian nesting doll . the internet has countless local area networks that then connect with larger, regional networks and ultimately with the backbone of the internet .

the wild asian elephant became stuck in a muddy quagmire in southern china . she was lying on her side in a state of desperation when locals came across her . using only ropes and wooden poles, more than 20 villagers and police officers teamed together to free the animal before she died of starvation, dehydration or exhaustion .

monumental qasr al-farid or 'the lonely castle' was constructed in the first century a.d. and situated on one of the most important ancient trade routes . the four-storey monument was actually used as a tomb, borrowing decorative elements from egyptian, hellenistic, and assyrian architecture . it is the largest of 131 tombs, which were carved straight into rock in the city of mada'in saleh during the pinnacle of nabatean era .

seven philippine crocodiles flew out of melbourne on wednesday en route to their native country . the 40 centimetre-long crocs travelled in custom designed boxes specially built by melbourne zoo . there are only about 250 philippine crocodiles left in the wild, making them the most endangered crocodile species in the world .

surrender order was sent by german president karl doenitz on may 8, 1945 . told officers to abandon fighting or face the wrath of the allies . found on luftwaffe chief robert von greim when he was arrested that day . doenitz had been hitler's choice to replace him as leader of the nazis . a week later, amid a crumbling and defeated reich, doenitz met with allied commanders to sign the instrument of surrender .

sunderland will not suspend adam johnson after he was charged with grooming and three counts of sexual activity with a 15-year-old girl . the black cats hierarchy have decided that the 27-year-old should be allowed to continue playing for the club until the outcome of his case has been decided . johnson has been bailed to appear before peterlee magistrates on may 20 – the same day sunderland travel to arsenal .

president barack obama and his wife, michelle, paid more than $93,000 in federal taxes last year on an adjusted gross income of more than $477,000 . the obamas lowered their 2014 tax bill by claiming nearly $160,000 in itemized deductions, including $70,712 in charitable donations to 33 different charities . the 38-page document, which includes the couple's illinois state income tax return, shows the president made nearly $395,000 in wages .

acetaminophen, the main ingredient in tylenol and more than 600 other medicines, reduces pain and pleasure . the study found that acetaminophen also blunted joy -- in other words, it narrowed the range of feelings experienced . "rather than just being a pain reliever, acetaminophen can be seen as an all-purpose emotion reliever," researcher says .

service, called 'project fi,' debuted today, about two months after google revealed its plans to expand its ever-growing empire into providing wireless connections for smartphones . google is selling the basic phone service for $20 a month and will only charge customers for the amount of cellular data that they use each month, instead of a flat rate . each gigabyte of data will cost $10 a month, meaning a customer could sign up for a plan offering three gigabytes of data and get $20 back if only one gigabyte was used in a month .

circular structure is a rare manifestation of gravitational lensing predicted by albert einstein in his theory of relativity . einstein's theory predicts that the gravitational effects of the nearer galaxy will bend the light of the more distant one .

uk researchers studied the asteroid impact 66 million years ago . they found the heat near the impact site in mexico was not intense enough to ignite plant material . a heat pulse lasted less than a minute, too short to set plants alight . it suggests our understanding of the mass extinction event that wiped out the dinosaurs may not be as complete as thought .

researchers from okinawa institute of science and technology graduate university (oist) in japan found a similar pattern in the namibian desert . they used satellite images of fairy circles and a computer to draw lines halfway between each pair to give them invisible boundaries that look similar to cell walls . majority of skin cells and fairy circles both had similar distributions . fairy circles are considered one of nature's greatest mysteries because no one knows how they form .

nasa's curiosity rover found liquid water close to the surface of mars . substance perchlorate has been found in the soil, which lowers the freezing point so the water does not freeze into ice, but is liquid and present in very salty water . when night falls, some of the water vapour in the atmosphere condenses on the planet surface as frost, but calcium perchlorate is very absorbent and forms a brine with the water .

research led by dr haimin wang from the new jersey institute of technology has revealed the first high-resolution footage of a solar flux 'rope' taking shape on the sun . in the video, twisting groups of magnetic fields writhe around a central axis before bursting from the sun . the rope eventually causes a bright flash - a solar flare - to form . it is thought to be the main cause of solar weather - including solar flares and coronal mass ejections .
