the variety theater in cleveland, ohio, was renowned for its rock concerts but everything changed when motorhead played a gig in 1984 . the ceiling cracked and pieces of plaster began to fall on the audience - ending the concert and the life of the venue . built in 1927, the venue was home to one of the earliest single screen cinemas in cleveland before becoming an iconic music venue .

measurements made by the european space probe philae, which landed on comet 67p in november, show the comet's core isn't magnetised . some astrophysicists have suggested that magnetism might have been responsible for aligning and then binding together rocks into larger boulders . but in a paper published online, the team led by hans-ulrich auster at the technical university of braunschweig, germany, said their data don't support this theory .
zoe dennise prince, 28, was working at the gold coast amusement park until september last year . she was allegedly injured on may 20, 2013 when she allegedly experienced pain her right wrist whilst checking harnesses on the ride . ms prince claims that she suffered her injury as the company ardent leisure was negligent and set poor working conditions . she is claiming $23,050 in general damages and $193,375 for her predicted loss of income in the future .
lincolnshire resort joins st ives and windermere in top ten league of towns . billy butlin located his first holiday park at skegness in 1936 . research revealed 165,000 people in england and wales have holiday homes . cornwall, with its 300 mile coastline, is nation's holiday home hotspot .

lucy is the oldest and most complete fossil of an early human ever found . discovered in 1974, the 3.2 million-year-old skeleton stunned archaeologists . now, a new look at the ancient hominin's skeleton suggests one of the bones may belong to a baboon .

president barack obama granted the cia an exemption relaxing restrictions on drone strikes in pakistan after enacting more stringent rules in 2013 . the waiver exempts the cia from providing proof that intended targets of drone strikes posed an imminent threat to the us . had the cia been subjected to the same stringent rules as other agencies, the january 15 drone strike that killed two hostages, one of them an american, could have been postponed or even prevented entirely .

'the diggers are dole bludgers' has attracted more than 360 likes since the page started in late january . the administrator of the page claims that those in the armed forces are 'being paid with money stolen from the taxpayer to do a job that is unnecessary' . the page claims that if the anzac's fought for freedom then the page exercises the right to freedom of speech .

the southern poverty law center in february filed a lawsuit against georgia department of corrections officials on behalf of ashley diamond, a transgender woman . the lawsuit says prison officials have failed to provide adequate treatment for diamond's gender dysphoria . the justice department reminds prison officials that the eighth amendment requires them to provide inmates with individualized assessment and care for the condition .

morrissey has written a public letter to australian retailer the just group . the just group have so far refused to back down on their stance in using angora wool . peta australia has successfully petitioned the just group to reconsider their position after revealing the horrific treatment of rabbits at chinese angora farms . 'by selling angora wool, you're sending the message to millions of shoppers that your company condone the barbaric abuse and slaughter of rabbits,' morrissey writes .
researchers at the university of illinois college of medicine found that binge drinking as a teenager can cause long-lasting damage to the brain . alcohol causes permanent changes in the dna in brain cells . this puts young people at risk of anxiety disorders and alcoholism . researchers found a cancer drug may be able to reverse the damage .

a man whose car smashed into a geelong house was allegedly attacked by a man who was inside the home at the time of the crash . police say the car crashed through a fence and into the front bedroom of the breakwater house . the four-month-old girl was airlifted to the royal children's hospital in melbourne where she remains in an induced coma . a man and a woman in their 20s, who were in the room at the time of the crash, are in geelong hospital with minor injuries .
seven-car maglev hit a top speed of 375mph (603 km/h) and travelled for almost 11 seconds at speeds above 373mph (600km/h) during a test run near mount fuji . it beat last week's speeds of 366mph (590kph), which in turn beat the train's previous 12-year record of 361mph (581km/h) the train is able to go this fast because it uses a charge to lift and move it above a guideway .

between 2011 and 2051, the uk's population will rise from 63.4 million to 77.4 million . white britons will increase by almost three million, but minority population will increase more than three times faster . by midpoint of 21st century minority ethnic communities will make up 24.3 per cent of the total population .

home secretary theresa may said the tory manifesto will spell out plans to negotiate a new deal with europe, including curbing access to benefits . unemployed eu migrants in britain will be banned from receiving state support, and would be deported if they do not get a job within six months of arriving . for those in work, they would be barred from claiming handouts like housing benefit or tax credits until they have been in the uk for four years .

paypal said that the devices would be powered by stomach acid . developer jonathan leblanc said that the next wave of passwords will be edible, ingestible or injectable . he said that passwords as they are now were not working and that users need to ‘harden it with something physical behind it’ . edible capsules could check the person’s glucose levels or blood pressure before beaming out encrypted data . other possibilities include silicon chips which are put under the skin and ‘wearable computer tattoos’ which send information via a wireless connection .

the study released on thursday by the centers for disease control and prevention found that about 30 percent of women who'd had a child became pregnant again within 18 months . experts say mothers should wait at least 18 months to give their body time to recover and increase the chances the next child is full-term and healthy . the report is based on 2011 birth certificates from 36 states and the district of columbia, representing about 83 percent of the nation's births that year .

it was previously thought that the woolly mammoth simply died out from post-ice age climate change and being hunted to extinction by early man . examination of more than 23,500 mammoth bones found them riddled with osteoporosis and lacking in calcium . the major mineral deficiency resulted in them breaking their limbs and spines, and left them unable to walk .

the best sleep quality worldwide occurs on a wednesday night . more than half (58 per cent) of countries surveyed said they had the most restful sleep on this day . on tuesdays, americans wake at 7am and are in the worst mood all week . slovakia topped the list, while the uk was in 45th place . other countries that wake-up grumpy on tuesdays include singapore, spain, switzerland, south africa and brazil .

almost half of dog owners did not know ticks can transmit deadly diseases . lyme disease, a potentially fatal illness caught from tick bites, affects pets as well as themselves . symptoms may be so mild that someone who's been bitten may experience only flu-like symptoms . ticks that carry the bacteria responsible for lyme disease are found throughout the uk and in other parts of europe and north america .

teller lake in boulder, colorado, has been invaded by 3,000 to 4,000 goldfish, which wildlife officials say started as someone dumping 'four or five' of their pets in the water two or three years ago . the animals have multiplied to over 3,000 or 4,000 and are threatening to over-run the natural species in the lake, by eating up all their resources and spreading unnatural diseases . local officials are now considering two options - electroshocking the fish or draining the lake completely .

london-based keyboard app firm swiftkey analysed more than one billion sets of emoji data to learn how 16 different languages and regions use emoji . happy faces, including winks, kisses, smiles and grins were the most popular across all regions, making up 45 per cent of all the messages studied . in the us, gadget users send 30 per cent more lgbt-related emoji than the average, including a rainbow, men holding hands or women holding hands .

researchers from the university of california santa barbara found the virus while exploring methane vents 2,800 feet beneath the surface of the ocean in japan . they discovered the bacteria that thrive on the fossil fuel deposits deep inside the earth - known as archae . virus causes one of its own genes to mutate - allowing it to develop new ways of coping with the environment it finds itself in . this has allowed archae bacteria to adapt to harsh environments .

the image was created by superimposing a blurry picture of marilyn monroe over a picture of albert einstein drawn in fine lines . features with a high spatial frequency (einstein) are only visible when you're viewing them close up, while those with low spatial frequencies (monroe) are only visible from further away . the trick can also be seen in a still image by anyone if they move closer and then farther away from the screen .

the shoe that grows has adjustable points at the front, sides and back of the sandal to help it expand by five sizes . pressure sensors in the shoe tell it when your foot is in position, triggering a tiny motor in the heel that pulls the laces tight . when you want to take off the shoes, click your heels together twice and the motor will release a spring in the shoe’s tongue . the invention even runs on power generated by the swing of your foot as you walk .

university of nebraska researcher has revealed why stress is bad for you . limited periods of stress are good, as they release the hormone cortisol . this is useful in helping you recover from very tense situations . but too much will lower your immune system and make your bones fragile . the science of stress was explained in a video for the american chemical society .

the quota system was abolished today after 30 years - allowing dairy farmers to produce as much milk as they like without suffering a financial penalty . the move is expected to drive a spike in production, particularly in countries like ireland, germany and the netherlands . as a result, a price war over the cost of milk is likely to break out, bringing down the price for consumers .

in 1992, a drug enforcement agency program monitored every phone call made from the united states to one of the up to 116 countries on their watch list for drug trafficking . this is now the oldest known example of the american government authorizing this level of tracking on unknowing citizens of the country . the program only recently shuttered, and was used for nearly two decades, with top justice department officials in four administrations .

cave was built near vallon-pont-d'arc in southern france . it contains 1,000 drawings of 425 animals and around 450 bones . cave is the oldest cave decorated by man but is not open to the public to keep the precious works of art safe . experts have scanned the original drawings using 3d modelling techniques to capture each marking and position them correctly on the bumpy replica walls .

researchers at different institutions in tokyo, noted that rats flatten their ears, narrow their eyes and puff up their cheeks when they are in pain – an observation in previous studies . they wanted to find out whether the rodents do this as a reflex reaction, or to communicate their discomfort to others . they found that rats can read pain on other animal’s faces and use the information to make decisions .
scientists in belgium say all sweet potatoes contain 'foreign dna' . agrobacterium bacteria in the crop exchanges genes between species . this makes sweet potatoes a 'natural genetically modified organism' and humans have been eating it for thousands of years . the researchers studied 291 sweet potatoes from the americas, africa, asia and oceania .

researchers at the university of huddersfield have created a technique which they claim can distinguish between the genetic fingerprints of identical twins . the breakthrough may eradicate a stumbling block which has often meant it was impossible to tell which of the pair was guilty of a crime . hrma subjects the dna to increasingly high temperatures until the hydrogen bonds break, known as the melting temperature . the more hydrogen bonds that are present in the dna, the higher the temperature required to melt them .

researchers from national chung hsing university in taiwan found its shape is determined by two competing groups of proteins . they converted lips into petals in two orchid species by reducing the activity of the 'l' complex and the 'sp' complex, using gene silencing . they found that in mature orchid flowers, the expression pattern suggests two protein complexes, called the 'l' complex and the 'sp' complex, compete to promote the formation of the lip and standard petals .

tao wei and yulong zhang found flaw on galaxy s5 running android 4.4 and older . flaw means that once a hacker has access they can monitor data recorded by built-in sensors, including the fingerprint scanner . when a fingerprint is scanned it is encrypted and separated from the rest of the phone . hackers typically can't access this encrypted file, but the flaw allows them to collect scans from the sensor before they reach this folder .

the native australian marsupial once occupied more than 70 per cent of the australian mainland . now it’s disappeared from around 80 per cent of that area with small populations remaining in queensland, the northern territory and western australia . in recent years the bilby has become an important part of the australian easter tradition . predators like feral cats and foxes are the biggest threat to the bilby populations .

london-based designer claims to have made the world's safest bike . called the babel bike it has a host of features including a roll cage . it has a small wheel at the front and a larger one on the back, with a lockable white bar connecting them that doubles as storage for the bike’s innards . the bike has an electric motor that assists it at speeds of up to 20mph in the us and 15.5mph in the eu .

fishermen in china keep a special, thousand year old tradition alive with just a bird, a gas lamp and a net . sailing peacefully across a river, the men men fish without the aid of a rod with this unusual method . the fishermen release a cormorant bird, which then dives into the water and retrieves a carp . the stunning images were captured on the river li in guilin, china, by a russian photographer .

'i find [it] extremely difficult to understand in spite of it having been the one i understood the best once!', he wrote . it was written at bletchley park code-breaking headquarters in 1942 . believed to be only extensive turing manuscript known to exist .

there is a rising number of firms in the us that sell dog and cat biscuits containing cannabidiol, or cbd, taken from hemp . compounds in the plant have been known to alleviate joint pains, treat mood disorders and even help pets lose weight . cannabis plants contain more than 60 unique compounds called cannabinoids . cannabis plants contain high levels of thc, classed as illegal in many countries and states, and hemp contains very little .

researchers at the university of california found that heart patients who expressed gratitude for the positive things in their life had improved mental, and ultimately physical, health . the study involved men and women who had been diagnosed with stage b heart failure . patients who were more grateful had lower markers of inflammation, which can often worsen heart failure .

university of illinois scientists have created the first 3d simulation of merging black holes in a disk . it shows what happens when two supermassive black holes collide . magnetic fields around the two become erratic, while the jets firing out from the ‘poles’ of each object merge into one . ripples in space-time caused by such an event are also predicted to be created by the merger . simulation was led by scientists at the university of illinois .

extra stretch of coastline on shiretoko peninsula near the town of rausu has risen as high as 50ft from the sea surface . geologists believe the emergence is a result of a landslide nearby, when melting ice and snow caused a section of land to drop . the mass, which has risen some 30 to 50ft above sea level, measures roughly 1,000- 1,640ft long, and 100ft wide .

european populations were dark skinned for far longer than thought . hunter gatherers living in spain up to 8,500 years ago still had dark skin . it was not until 7,800 years ago, when the first farmers migrated from the near east through turkey, that two key genes that provide lighter skin appeared .

flakka can be injected, snorted, smoked, swallowed or taken with marijuana . it is usually made from the synthetic chemical alpha-pvp . that's the synthetic version of cathinone, the same chemical used to make bath salts . once ingested, flakka causes a feeling of euphoria, hallucinations and sometimes psychosis or apparent superhuman strength . the high lasts for a couple of hours and users are left with a strong desire to use again .

the white-cheeked macaque, from tibet, china, has a distinctive rounded penis rather than the arrow shaped genitalia found on other species . officially named macaca leucogenys, it earned its common name due to the pale whiskers on its chin and the side of its face . videos have also revealed that the animal has a distinctive alarm calls compared to other macaques in tibet .

anaesthetic gases used to send patients to sleep during surgery are accumulating in the earth's atmosphere . concentrations have been rising globally in the past decade . the gases - desflurane, isoflurane and sevoflurane - have 2,500 times the impact on global warming compared to carbon dioxide .

chancellor appeared to leave the door open when asked if he would be ‘depriving more families’ of child benefit payments . more than a million households lost out when coalition announced families with one parent earning £50,000 would pay tax on child benefit . anyone earning less than £50,000 still received full entitlement of £20.70 a week for the first child, and £13.70 for every subsequent child . conservatives say they would cut £30bn of spending if they win a second term .

some 40 miles north of san antonio, stands a bedraggled, tin-sided building that hints at texas' past . kendalia halle was built more than 100 years ago by german immigrants, who through the latter half of the 19th century comprised more than 5 percent of the state's population . about 400 such halls still stand — many unused and decaying — but only two traditional texas dance halls continue to operate on nearly a daily basis .

everything that’s unpleasant about male behaviour is ascribed to testosterone . but as joe herbert explains, testosterone is at the heart of human life . the blood of an adult woman before menopause contains about five times more testosterone than oestrogen, the supposedly ‘female’ hormone .

primatologists at iowa state university recorded 300 hunts by chimps in fongoli, sénégal . found female chimps were using tools to capture prey in 60 per cent of the observations . it may also provide tantalising hints at how humans first learned to use weapons to hunt .

north sentinel island belongs to india and remains an enigma despite being populated for an estimated 60,000 years . very little is known about the sentinelese people, their language, their rituals and the island they call home . visitors who venture onto or too close to the island risk being attacked by members of a mysterious tribe who have rejected modern civilisation . the tribe killed two men who were fishing illegally in 2006 and have been known to fire arrows and fling rocks at low-flying planes or helicopters on reconnaissance missions .

researchers from cnrs-gate in lyon and the university of california, analysed the behaviour of both sexes when the study participants were asked to choose between being paid on their individual performance or as part of a team . they found that male 5,000 metre runners are more competitive than women . sportswomen tend to be more committed to aspects of their lives outside sport - such as their academic studies - than their male counterparts .

the red lady's remains were found in the el mirón cave in cantabria, spain . radiocarbon dating suggests she was buried 18,700 years ago . when the remains were first uncovered they were stained with a sparking red material, later found to be red ochre from a haematite crystal . this suggests she was aged between 35 and 40 when she was entombed . her grave provides the first evidence of an ancient magdalenian burial in the region .
called the michigan micro mote, to tiny technology is a complete computer system . michigan micro mote contains solar cells that power the battery with ambient light, including indoor rooms with no natural sunlight .

nasa scientists in california have revealed an interactive 3d map for vesta using images from the dawn spacecraft . the map lets you see features on the surface including craters, hills, mountains and even 'canyons' the asteroid completes a rotation every five hours and 18 minutes, with a temperature ranging from -3°c (27°f) to -188°c (-306°f) the map also lets you 3d print an entire model of vesta .

university of manchester researchers have revealed an hd dark matter map . it shows clumps of mystery particles across 0.4 per cent of the sky . the goal is to eventually map 12.5 per cent over five years . red here shows more dark matter, and blue shows less . the moon is shown top left for scale . and the map should allow astronomers to study how galaxies formed in the universe .

the megalithic site of gunung padang was discovered in 1914 and is the largest site of its kind in indonesia . it is nestled among volcanoes, banana palms and tea plantations, at 2,903 ft (885 metres) above sea level . geologist dr danny hilman believes the site is revered because it hides an ancient temple built between 9,000 and 20,000 years ago . if true, it could shed light on an obscure yet powerful and advanced ancient civilisation .

the rubber bowl in akron, ohio, was built in 1939 and it served as the home for the university of akron's football team for 65 years . the university purchased the title to the stadium from the city of akron for just $1 in 1971 . the rubber bowl hosted 310 ua football contests, 19 preseason cleveland browns' games and a regular-season nfl game in 1952 .

the first ever drawing of the beatles' famous yellow submarine is set to fetch more than £10,000 at auction in dallas, texas . it depicts the eponymous submarine from the 1968 film in which the fab four travel to pepperland to save it from the blue meanies . rare celluloid painting, known as a cel, was used as a master version from which artists working on the film created all other images . more than 240 artists and animators worked full time for an entire year to produce the film using revolutionary techniques .

just over a quarter of women giving birth in england now have a caesarean . the rate has more than doubled since the early 1990s . this includes a growing number of women opting to have planned caesareans because they are very anxious about giving birth naturally . experts from the world health organisation said this figure should ideally be between 10 per cent and 15 per cent due to the dangers and costs involved .

campaigning group getup launched the gender price gap website last week . members and everyday consumers have identified nine separate products that have identical female versions which cost more . this is despite the products being identical in almost every way except whether they are targeted towards women or men . the exact same shirt advertised under the men's clothing section is advertised for only $49.95 . other examples highlighted on the website show price increases from as little as 11c or even 1c for items marketed towards females .

lusitanian toadfish live in rocky crevices in the mediterranean sea and atlantic ocean . they make five types of calls and males can even sing in choruses . males build nests under rocks during mating season, which runs from may to july and sing to attract female visitors . because males are territorial, their song serves as a warning for rivals .

scientists at the university of connecticut say we know how far away the source of a sound is by listening to the echoes it produces . in a study they found that the reverberation of sound helps us locate the distance of, for example, a car passing round a bend or a person nearby . the research was conducted by scientists from the university of connecticut and published in the journal of neuroscience . they said that echoes and fluctuations in volume are the cues we use to figure out the distance between us and the source of a noise .

scientists used a new technique to reconstrcut the colourful patterns on 28 fossilised cone snail shells that are up to 6.6 million years old . under ultraviolet light traces of pigment still in the shells are revealed, allowing their colours to be reconstrcuted . instead of being a simple white colour, they were infact covered in streaks of orange, purple, blue and even large pokadots . scientists now believe the cone snail shells, which come from the northern dominican republic, include 13 entirely new species .

bolivia’s cal orcko paleontological site is the result of tectonic activity, forcing earth upwards . the attraction, at fancesa limestone quarry in sucre, comprises some 462 trails made up of 5,055 prints . landslides reveal new ones, some of which belong to unknown species . the wall, which is the largest dinosaur trackway in the world, is approximately 390 feet (120 metres) tall .

romeo and juliet were found lying next to each other in a 75-million-year-old rock . palaeontologists at the university of alberta examined a pair of fossils found in mongolia, which were first described in 2001 . one is a complete skeleton, while the other is missing the middle and end of its tail . they believe they can tell males and females apart from certain tail bones .

china has built an airstrip on disputed fiery cross reef in the spratly islands . the philippines, vietnam, malaysia, brunei and taiwan all claim the area . new satellite images reveal the country has built the runway there . they show fiery cross reef as untouched by man-made structures in 2014 . but by march this year, it had been transformed into an artificial island . it could be used for military operations and a runway could be built .

hawaii scientists say a supervoid may account for an anomaly in the cosmic microwave background radiation (cmb) of the universe . in 2004 astronomers first found the 'cold spot' - a region 20 per cent less dense than elsewhere - and may now have an explanation . if confirmed, the supervoid would be the largest single structure ever found by humanity .

synaesthesia is a neurological condition where two senses are joined together . some synaesthetes experience colour when they hear sounds or read words, while others experience tastes, smells or shapes . researchers from stanford university used data from 6,588 registered users to determine which colours are most commonly associated with which letters . they then compared these colour-letter matches to fridge magnets sold by fisher-price between 1971 and 1990 . results revealed that at least six per cent (400 out of the 6588 participants) learnt 'many of their matches' from the fisher

yaphank, in the 1930s, appeared as a haven for americans--most of them of german heritage--who sympathized with the causes of the third reich . in fact, it was largely founded as a nazi camp, one of several scattered across the u.s. where the children in the german american bund (aka american nazis) could fish, swim, hunt and learn about things like eugenics .

an average australian sheds the equivalent of a 50 gram packet of chips every week in dry skin . dust mites are the number one cause of allergies in australian homes . more than 1,000 dust mites live in just one metre square of carpet and they produce approximately 2000 droppings in their lifetime . the odd shaped critters increase two to three fold during late autumn to winter leading thousands of australians to suffer from common cold or flu-like symptoms .

dna extracted from bones found in cave in altamura, southern italy, has revealed they belong to a neanderthal who fell down a sinkhole around 150,000 years ago . he was wedged in the narrow space and probably badly injured . over the thousands of years that followed, the body decayed and the remaining bones became incorporated into the stalactites left behind by water dribbling down the cave walls .

cancer research uk found 'achilles heel' in prostate cancer which could lead to better treatment for many men . disease claims almost 11,000 lives a year in the uk, with most deaths occurring after it spreads around the body . scientists studied samples taken from tumours in the prostate and around the body in ten affected men . reading the dna revealed details of how the cancer metastasises, or spreads, allowing them to build a ‘family tree’ of how the disease changes over time .

scientists in california have described how to create artificial auroras on earth . they said a particle accelerator could be sent 185 miles (300km) up into space . it would then fire high-energy beams back at earth's atmosphere . pulses of the beam would last just 0.1 microseconds and would last just 0.1 microseconds . the aurora borealis is caused when electrons from the solar wind collide with atoms of oxygen and nitrogen in the earth's atmosphere .

hyalinobatrachium dianae was found in the mountains of eastern costa rica . its body is green on its backs, while its abdominal skin is translucent . this means the animal’s heart, liver and gastrointestinal tract are visible . it is distinguishable from other glass frogs by its long toes and black eyes .

20 stone flakes and anvils were found near lake turkana in kenya . they were used to shape tools created hundreds of thousands of years before the appearance of the first 'man' - the start of our branch of the evolutionary tree known as homo . the discovery could fundamentally change the current view of human evolution as - if correct - the date of the stone tools is 700,000 years older than any others found previously .

us researchers discovered that a single gene called tcsad1 is responsible for the melting point of cocoa butter . plant geneticists say their finding could lead to new varieties of climate change-resistant cocoa plants, which could boost plants’ yields and the income of farmers . the world cocoa foundation puts annual cocoa production worldwide at 3.8 million tons, valued at $11.8 billion (£7.9 billion) each cocoa pod has 40 seeds, which are composed of cocoa butter and used in the making of chocolate – and some drugs .

three studies have provided different theories for what happened after earth was struck by a mars-sized object called theia, 4.45 billion years ago . what is agreed on, though, is that the impact actually happened . this is known as the giant impact hypothesis . it claims the impact created a huge cloud of debris that mixed thoroughly with earth and then later condensed to form the moon . or theia could have been isotopically similar to young earth . or the moon could have formed from earthen materials, explaining the similarity between earth and the moon .

the kidneys were extracted from a 45-year-old indian man suffering from autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease (adpkd) condition causes fluid-filled cysts to grow in the kidneys, so they expand in size . a week after his initial operation, a second kidney weighing 5.5lbs (2.5kg) was removed . both kidneys beat the previous record of 4.7lbs (2.1kg) which was removed in dhule, india, in 2011 .

study by university of jyvaskyla found exercise can increase grey matter in the brain, increasing the size of areas that contribute to balance and coordination . the changes in the brain may have health implications in the long-term, such as reducing the risk of falling . previous research found exercise is linked to lower levels of body fat, a reduced risk of heart disease, better memory and thinking, and a lower risk of type 2 diabetes .

fireball crackled across the sky near the russian-finnish border last year . it shared its orbit with asteroid 2014 ur116, which is due to pass by the moon in 2017 . this is according to a new study which claims the kola fireball had a 'disturbingly similar' path to the asteroid . researchers used camera footage to help recreate its trajectory . they determined the fireball's path by studying its flight and the meteorite's final impact site, before creating a computer model .

the rare albino bottlenose dolphin has been making waves at the taiji whale museum in southern japan . while bottlenose dolphins are typically grey, the mammal is completely white– apart from the quirky tendency to turn pink when it's feeling angry, sad or even embarrassed . the pink tone is a result of the animals thin skin, which means its blood vessels can cause a change in skin tone depending on their emotional state . the rare specimen is believed to be only the second one ever put on display in an aquarium after it was purchased from fishermen last year .

caitlin kellie-jones developed hypoxic ischemic encephalopathy (hie) it occurs when the brain does not receive enough oxygen or blood . she was placed in a cooling wrap to keep her at 33.5 degrees for 72 hours . caitlin was diagnosed with hie minutes after birth and given hypothermia . the wrap allows the brain to cool down and minimises the damage . she is now ten months old and is able to feed and play .

harvard-led study has mapped taste buds on a tongue for the first time . scientists examined the different cells used to identify taste and watched these cells capture and process molecules live . they were able to spot blood vessels up to 240 microns (0.0024mm) below the surface of the tongue . the researchers say the sensory changes are tied to cold antarctic temperatures, where penguins originated .

skeletons were found on top of one another in the tomb from korea’s silla dynasty . archaeologists are almost certain that the tomb was intended for a noblewoman, because her body is carefully positioned to face the sky . the man she is lying with may have been killed so he could be buried with her . the tomb is made of soil and stone and was discovered last december in hwangnam-dong, a neighbourhood of gyeongju city in south korea .

garnet, montana, was established in the 1860s by miners looking for gold and silver, but it was devastated by fire in 1912 . the town has since been restored, but remains empty, and local folklore says the area is haunted by former residents . the u.s. bureau of land management is offering free food, housing a job to people willing to live in garnet and work as a tour operator .

property prices are predicted to fall by up to 10 per cent in some states with economists tipping a housing surplus in 2017 . goldman sachs predicts population growth will slow to 1.25 per cent over the next three years due to low birth rates, high death rates and falling net migration . this is significantly lower than widely-used australian bureau of statistics population predictions of between 1.7 and 1.8 per cent . this will create an oversupply and see property prices fall by between 5 and 10 per cent in markets where construction supply has been strong .

$250 (£168) neurio sensor is plugged into the house’s breaker panel . it measures voltage and current signals every split second . signals are sent to the neurio cloud where algorithms identify appliances and behaviours based on unique electronic signals . when the algorithms detect that a device has been turned on or off, or a user returning home, they notify the neurio app . neurio feeds information about energy consumption back to an app .

university of waterloo astrophysicists have created a 3d master map of the universe spanning nearly two billion light years . the innovative spherical map of galaxy superclusters is the most complete picture of our cosmic neighbourhood to date . it will help astrophysicists understand how matter is distributed in the universe and provide key insights into dark matter .

a brave hippopotamus stood its ground against two hungry lions in the depths of zimbabwe's hwange national park . at first, as the lions approach the large hippo, the hippo tries to scare them off before wandering towards nearby water . however, as the lions continue to prowl, the animal abruptly turns around and charges towards the two predators . researcher brent stapelkamp, 37, has been studying the activities and behaviour of lions in the reserve for years .

police went to a home on march 26 in balch springs, texas, to do a wellness check and were told that a two-year-old child had died and a 'rising ceremony' was performed . the child's parents took the body to mexico the following day . five children under the age of ten, both boys and girls, were also living at the home and had been taken away by child protective services .

skopelos is a greek island known as the film location for mamma mia . it has a ruined venetian fortress and dozens of chapels . the island has a relaxed, offbeat vibe .

the cheyenne mountain complex was built for the north american aerospace command (norad) to direct the response to a nuclear war with the ussr during the cold war . the complex is home to more than 1,000 personnel and operates as an underground town for months with fresh water and food . the pentagon announced this week that cheyenne mountain will once again be home to the most advanced tracking and communications equipment in the us military .

the 11 defendants - including teachers, a principal and other administrators - were convicted wednesday of racketeering . they were accused of falsifying test results to collect bonuses or keep their jobs in the 50,000-student atlanta school system . the educators fed answers to students or erased and changed the answers on tests after they were turned in to secure promotions or up to $5,000 each in bonuses . however the person accused of benefiting the most from the conspiracy, superintendent beverly hall, died of breast cancer over the course of the trial .

protoaurignacian culture arrived in southern europe 40,000 years ago . neanderthals were dominant human species in europe and much of asia for 250,000 years before vanishing entirely 41,000 years ago . scientists took ct scans of teeth found at riparo bombrini in western ligurian alps and in the grotta di fumane in western lessini mountains in italy . they found the enamel on the crown of the teeth was thicker than that found on neanderthal teeth .

sonnenspeicher uses a lithium iron phosphate battery to store energy harnessed by solar panels fitted to a roof . this energy can be used throughout the day, and any excess is stored for when the sun goes down . rather than selling this excess electricity back to the grid, homeowners can then use their stored supply for power . sonnenspeicher has an intelligent management system that automatically controls the charging and discharging current . it additionally has a sleep mode that ensures the storage system never runs low and will automatically go into standby when not in use .

this happens when the sun-lit surface waters of the ocean become devoid of oxygen and are poisoned by hydrogen sulphide . life of the triassic met a choking end in a runaway greenhouse climate, heating the seas into warm stagnation . scientists fear that the planet today could suffer similar consequences caused by the amount of carbon dioxide being created through the burning of fossil fuels .

the great dying, which struck the earth 252 million years ago, wiped out more than 96% of the world's creatures . and while volcanic eruptions are commonly blamed for triggering the event, the majority of species were ultimately killed when the oceans became more acidic . university of edinburgh researchers claim the volcanic eruptions released huge amounts of carbon dioxide which were absorbed into the oceans . this changed their chemical compositions and killed species .

children who ate a diet high in saturated fats and cholesterol had slower reaction times and a poorer working memory . children who ate the fatty diet performed worse when they were given a task-switching game to complete . the game was designed to test cognitive flexibility, which is our ability to shift attention, select information and alter our response strategy to fit the changing demands of a task .

scientists at the national oceanic and atmospheric administration's pacific marine environmental laboratory were able to record an underwater volcano erupting . they found that underwater volcanoes, which were long assumed to ooze lava at relatively steady rates, in fact erupt in pulses . the eruptions also appear to be clustered during the first six months of each year . the findings may mean that models predicting how human activity will change the climate will need to be adjusted .

national grid has revealed the uk's first new pylon for nearly 90 years . called the t-pylon it is a third shorter than the old lattice pylons . but it is able to carry just as much power - 400,000 volts . it is designed to be less obtrusive and will be used for clean energy purposes . britain's first pylon was erected in july 1928 near edinburgh .

the research was carried out by scientists at brown university in rhode island . to conduct the study, the researchers pitted nine frequent gamers against a control group of nine people who game rarely, if ever . subjects were shown an on-screen ‘texture’ of visual or horizontal lines . they had to quickly point out - in a fraction of a second - the one area where an anomalous texture appeared . results showed gamers managed to improve performance on both tasks, while non-gamers did what was expected .

bikram yoga involves performing 26 poses in a room heated to 40°c (105°f) scientists at the university of wisconsin-la crosse have warned the practise can raise a person's body temperature and heart rate to dangerous levels . a typical 90-minute session lasts for 90 minutes and is performed in a room heated to 40°c (105°f) with 40 per cent humidity . scientists advise that the standard 90-minute class is reduced to just an hour to reduce risks .

the wak ⁇  alarm clock is affixed to a wall behind the bed . it pivots to send a focused beam of light and sound to wake up an individual . led lights grow brighter to simulate sunlight, encouraging a sleeper to wake up more naturally . device uses an inbuilt sensor to pick out individuals using body heat . it also has rechargeable batteries and a wi-fi connected processor .

kuku kube was created by canada-based network365 . it is available for free on facebook, android, ios and on desktop browsers . players get a point for every correct square identified, but if they click or tap the wrong square they lose a point . scores lower than 11 are poor, scores between 15 and 20 is 'lower than average', 21 to 30 is considered normal or average, and a score higher than 31 means your eyesight is considered great .

study by the london school of hygiene and tropical medicine . those who were overweight (with a bmi of 25 to 29) had an 18 per cent lower risk of dementia compared to those with a healthy bmi . obese (with a bmi of 30 plus) did even better; they were 24 per cent less likely to develop dementia . being underweight increased the dementia risk by 39 per cent .

brain scans on professional comedians revealed differences in the way the brains of these 'super speakers' work while talking . the super speakers showed less activity in a key area of the brain involved articulating and comprehending speech . this suggests that this group were putting less effort into the basic mechanics of speech, allowing them to devote more resources to what they were going to say next .

nasa’s mars reconnaissance orbiter captured a shot of curiosity near the base of mount sharp in gale crater . but the rover’s tracks are not visible - possibly because they have been swept away by the martian weather . the image was taken using the high-resolution imaging science experiment (hirise) camera on the martian satellite . it is the fourth rover to visit mars and took around seven minutes to land on the red planet .

called the modular robotic vehicle, or mrv, it was developed at nasa's johnson space center to show off the technologies that could let man move across other planets . mrv is driven by four independent wheel modules called e-corners . each e-corner consists of a redundant steering actuator, a passive trailing arm suspension, an in-wheel propulsion motor, and a motor-driven friction braking system .

baron the german shepherd was captured in a video using the toilet after he began learning the impressive skill a few weeks ago . in the footage, the five-month-old pup enters the bathroom and lifts up the toilet seat . he then climbs up balancing his paws on the raised seat cover as he holds himself up and hovers over the toilet while relieving himself . once he's finished, he puts down both the toilet seat and flushes before running out .

toyal lotus technology stops yoghurt from sticking to lids of pots . german maker toyo aluminium's technology won silver place in the 2013 du pont awards for packaging innovation . it is inspired by the water-repellent nature of a lotus leaf and uses microscopic bumps to stop liquids from sticking . lotus leaves repel water to prevent being weighed down by rain, for example .

the storm system, which stretches from texas up to the great lakes and down to north carolina, has the potential to be the biggest severe weather event so far this spring . hail of up to 4 inches in diameter smashed buildings and cars and high winds tore off roofs and downed trees, as wild weather hit 12 states . strong storms rumbled through the southern plains early on thursday, missing major population centers but offering a preview of bad weather that could hit chicago, detroit and other big cities in the midwest later
solar probe plus will carry four instrument suites into the corona . will study the solar wind and energetic particles as they blast off the surface of the star . temperatures outside the spacecraft will reach nearly 2,500 degrees fahrenheit . over 24 orbits, the mission will use seven flybys of venus to reduce its distance from the sun .

a silicon valley-based start-up is offering an at-home dna saliva test to detect the same gene mutations priced at just $249 (£167) it tests for mutations in brca1 and brca2, along with 17 other markers, all of which are linked to an increased risk of breast and ovarian cancer . women with a mutation in brca1 have a lifetime risk of up to 80 percent for developing breast cancer and up to a 50 percent chance of developing ovarian cancer .
a frothy private sector is gearing up to serve the "test me" market . laboratories are offering walk-in and online services to individuals . the primary effect won't be more health, but rather more medical care .

washington, dc-based company wants to create a new space station . their giant cylinder could apparently replace the iss . it would rotate four times per minute to create artificial gravity . it would be 1,300ft (400 metres) long, cost £200 billion ($300 billion) and take 30 years to build . the final design would be 330ft (100 metres) in diameter and 1,310ft (400 metres) long .

vincent cianni, 63, has spent three years traveling the u.s. photographing and interviewing gay veterans and servicemen . he embarked on the project, gays in the military, to better understand why homosexuals would enlist in the military . cianni's photos show commonalities between the subjects despite their different journeys, from a 92-year-old ww2 veteran to young soldiers who recently returned from afghanistan .

israel marks its annual day of remembrance for fallen troops and slain civilians on wednesday . yom hazikaron - or memorial day - is held the day before israel's independence day . under law all places of entertainment, including cinemas, theatres and nightclubs are closed during the sombre day .
study by ofcom says 4g speeds in the uk are slower than promised . mobile phone companies boasted 4g would be five times faster than 3g . but the actual figure is actually only 2.5 times faster - 14.7 megabits per second compared to 5.9mbit/s per second on the 3g service that most people use . ee’s 4g network, which covers 81 per cent of homes and businesses, delivered the fastest average download speed of 18.6mbit/s . vodafone came second fastest, followed by o2 at

coin was found in silt after the river avon burst its banks between bristol and bath . experts have dated it to between 300 bc and 264 bc and say it came from the western mediterranean - probably sardinia or ancient carthage . it is thought to be the oldest dateable evidence of human activity found in saltford and the west of england . coin is thought to be the oldest evidence of human activity .

scientists in colorado have found evidence for a new solar season cycle . every two years it appears 'bands' of magnetic field move to the surface . this combines with the existing 11-year solar cycle, causing even more powerful coronal mass ejections (cmes) and solar flares that can endanger earth . when the seasons combine, the activity of the sun can be amplified .

researchers scanned the brains of people reading passages from the collection . they found 'arousing words' affected parts of the brain concerned with emotion . valence refers to how positive or negative a word is, while arousal refers to its 'physiological intensity' . study screened seven harry potter novels - harry potter and the sorcerer's stone (1997), harry potter and the chamber of secrets (1998), harry potter and the goblet of fire (2001) .

a memorial will be held at the eat your greens function centre in eugowra, near ms scott's home town of canowindra . the 26-year-old teacher was set to wed her childhood sweetheart aaron leeson-woolley at the eat your greens centre in eugowra on saturday . a memorial will be held at 1pm this wednesday .
elderflower fields festival will be held in pippingford park for the second year running . the independent festival was created in 2012 by a small team of friends . it is about giving children and families the chance to take part in a huge range of activities .
porto face bayern munich in champions league quarter-final first leg . julen lopetegui's side are undefeated in the competition so far . bayern beat shakhtar donetsk 7-0 in first leg at dragao on wednesday .
catherine nevin was jailed for life in 2000 for arranging to have husband shot . the 62-year-old was allowed out on day release on wednesday afternoon . she was allowed to attend an addiction studies course in dublin . the course is part of her pre-release plan to integrate back into society .
supermarket publishes list of healthy tips on its staff website . industry insiders say move is to 'smarten up' tesco stores .
ben cousins, 36, has been on bail and was due to face fremantle magistrates court on wednesday morning . cousins was arrested on march 11 after allegedly leading police on a low speed chase from bicton to mosman park . he was charged with reckless driving, failing to stop and refusing a breath test . the former west coast eagles captain has a history of substance abuse . cousins has been hospitalised twice in the past fortnight after a string of alleged incidents .
john goodwin, 75, went on trial this week on six counts of aggravated felonious sexual assault . prosecutors said that atkinson, who pleaded not guilty, repeatedly sexually assaulted a student, who is now 24 years old . the former student testified he didn't come forward until 2013 because he was embarrassed . goodwin was airlifted to a hospital with life-threatening injuries from the self-inflicted gunshot wound .
a russian truck overtook a cyclist on the st petersburg ring road . the truck clipped the cyclist and knocked him out of his bicycle . ruslan bazarov suffered pelvic injuries and a broken leg in the accident . the cyclist cried out in pain due to the seriousness of his injuries .
intrepid travel have decided not to take any more bookings to nepal until may 11 . those planning on travelling before this date have been offered a refund . british foreign office has advised tourists to follow the advice .
china's navy rescued 225 foreign nationals and almost 600 chinese citizens . they included 176 people from pakistan, ethiopia, singapore and italy . a turkish naval frigate has evacuated 55 turks from aden .
rose devereux, 49, was left in agony after years of alleged incompetent treatment . bottom row of teeth virtually destroyed by terrible gum disease and crowns . she now faces a bill of £30,000 to get her smile back .
kay-ann morris, 23, is on trial for murdering shanay walker, seven . court heard she was subjected to 'repeated acts of cruelty' by her aunt . shanay was found cold and stiff in her bed by paramedics last july . morris told police officers shanay had fallen down the stairs . but 23-year-old was later arrested and charged with murder .
ben morgan is hopeful of playing for england at the forthcoming world cup . the gloucester no 8 broke his left leg playing against saracens in the aviva premiership in early january . morgan scored two tries during england's victory over australia five months ago .
manchester united lost 3-0 at home to everton in the premier league . goals from james mccarthy, john stones and kevin mirallas did not flatter everton . louis van gaal said that united could not match everton's commitment .
a study of 2.3 million australian parents has pinpointed 7.35am as the most hectic, frenzied time of day . parents spend an average of 140 hours making breakfast each year . aussie kids eat nut spreads 6.7 times a week .
adele adkins, 26, has amassed £5million in the last year despite releasing no new music . mother-of-one has double the wealth of her nearest rivals zayn malik, 22 . ed sheeran, 24, has enjoyed the biggest rise taking his fortune to £20million . ellie goulding, leona lewis, jessie j and katie melua are also worth £13million .
ellanora arthur baidoo has been trying to divorce her husband for several years . she has been able to reach victor sena blood-dzraku by phone .
government has approved funding for cambridgeshire-based mole solutions . the plan aims to reduce the level of road freight within urban areas . freight would be transported in capsules to edge of town consolidation centres . project is set to last nine months and if successful could be rolled out in other towns .
yvonne deegan, 77, described the investigation as 'absolutely diabolical' her husband bernie deegan, 70, died suddenly earlier this year following a 12-year cancer battle . police last week told mrs deegan that his death is one of four being investigated as part of a probe into dr rory lyons . islanders have said it was concerns over the unexpected death of mr cosheril's cousin karen from pneumonia in january .
researchers found coffee can stop the growth of tumours in women who have already been treated with the drug tamoxifen . tamoxifen blocks oestrogen from reaching the cancer cells . this means the cancer either grows more slowly or stops growing altogether .
charlie chaplin's divorce papers lay bare his 'cruel and inhumane' treatment of his teenage bride lita grey during their short-lived marriage . the 50-page papers were found in a bank in america and are set to fetch an estimated £15,000 when they go under the hammer . chaplin, then 35, married his second wife lita, 16, in 1924 and the union lasted just three years .
james tomkins dislocated his shoulder in the gym last month . the west ham defender has undergone successful surgery . tomkins hopes to return to action before the end of the season .
marco negri joined rangers from perugia for £3.5million in 1997 . he scored 23 goals in his first 10 league games for the scottish giants . but a series of injuries destabilised his career in glasgow .
anderson silva will meet with brazilian taekwondo officials in the hope of competing in next year's olympics . the brazilian taekwondo confederation said wednesday that 'this wonderful possibility' of silva competing in the olympics will be discussed next week . silva is currently suspended by ufc after failing drug tests .
teenager was dragged from a bus stop and brutally raped by a man . the 18-year-old was hit over the head 20 times with a rock and dragged into a garden . she was raped by the man and left for dead in the beeston area of leeds . victim will speak out in tonight's episode of crimewatch in which she tells reporters she is too scared to sleep for fear of reliving the ordeal in her dreams .
jamelia said obese women 'should feel uncomfortable' about their size . the loose women panellist aired her views on the itv show in a discussion about overweight teenagers . now the plus-size industry has spoken out about her comments .
12 per cent of brits think baby should be named after william's mother . diana the princess of wales is the favourite option if it is a girl . alice and charlotte were next in preference with nine per cent of the vote .
bastian schweinsteiger picked up an ankle injury during bayern munich's 1-0 win over borussia dortmund on saturday . bayern said that schweinsteiger's injury wasn't too serious . schweinsteiger will miss bayer leverkusen's quarter-final tie on wednesday .
fbi agent timothy pappa claims translator xiaoming gao was paid 'thousands of dollars to provide information on u.s. persons and a u.s. government employee' . the affidavit also revealed that gao lived with a state department employee who had top-secret clearance . as for the alleged spy she spoke to, their names was 'teacher zhao,' and the two met numerous times over the years in hotels in china .
